Ruling by the Book

Chapter 11: Plans


______________________________________________________________________


- Kazuya -


I checked the data of another chakra beast in my Grimoire.


“Chakra reserves have increased by 30 percent since the administration of the drug.” This version of the drug was much better than the last one.


This mutated dog was quite stable, one of the best experimental subjects.


Some were easy to manage but some were hard to contain like a mutated komodo dragon was easily twenty feet tall and could actually breathe fire while the mutated snake was still growing at thirty three feet length.


Moreover, the more they grow, the better results the ritual gives, so I planned to let them grow for a while and do the ritual during the winter solstice for the best results.


The forest outside the capital was being transformed into a place to raise chakra beasts. Civilians are barred from entering the place.


Constructing the walls around the place was a herculean task. We needed strong walls and then fuinjutsu strengthening of those walls so that the beasts don’t break out and slaughter the people of the capital.


Another thing we had discovered during these experiments was that the flesh of the chakra beasts was far more nutritious than normal beast’s flesh. In fact, even the milk of these animals was better, not to mention the quantity they produced was far better than normal animals.


The quality of wool from the mutated sheep was better too.


This made me change my plans slightly.


We began raising mutated cows, goats, pigs and sheep in large numbers. Raising and domesticating them from the start and in large numbers wasn’t something anyone had done before. Not to mention no one would think of them to be used for wars.


This way, I can create a new source of income for our country as well as create a stable and high quality supply of meat to feed my soldiers too.


Large scale production of mutated bears and more dangerous animals was still not possible and I had only a very limited number of them in my warehouse.


This is a very long term project and would probably require a few years to complete. My own version of ‘Forest of Death’, both as a place for trials and raising chakra beasts.


But looking at the amount of work needed for constructions, I was planning to teach the students Earth Style Jutsu, to construct walls.


After all, not everyone has wood style like Hashirama and can magically prop up a village out of nowhere.


Maybe someday, I will get to that level too.


I was still growing in strength right now, even without rituals. It’s better to gain some skills rather than just be all brute strength. After all, as I was right now, all it would take was a well aimed kunai to the eye to take me down.


Not to say I was weak.


I had mastered the Water Breathing Style, Advanced level Fuinjutsu and could open up to five gates.


Even without much knowledge of ninjutsu, I was still at a jōnin level of strength, maybe even elite jōnin if I went all out.


That said, I lacked their experience, something I have been working hard to gain in the last few months.


Seraphim has been coaching me on how to fight against ninjas.


It wasn’t just all spars but more basic things like avoiding attacks, dodging kunai and traps, fighting multiple enemies at a time as well as having better awareness of my surroundings. While these may seem basic, these things were the difference between life and death in a real battle.


After that came spars and the most challenging spars were with Toji and Kuroka, none of which I ever won.


Both of them were stronger than me physically as well as incredibly tricky.


Spars with Kuina were relatively straight forward although that girl just keeps pushing herself more and more each day and every time she recovers, she seems stronger than before.


It was as if she had some kind of zenkai… she didn’t. I checked. It was just the ridiculous One Piece physique.


With the dedicated training and proper healing from Rose, her talents were coming out.


She had learned to open her fifth gate too and was now on par with me with her swordsmanship alone.


Kuina was a bonafide genius in swordsmanship.


There was no doubt about it.


She even managed to incorporate the breathing styles and Saitō’s swordsmanship on her own and was still progressing even without anyone’s help. But I noticed that her speed was slowing down.


Before long, I would need to find a good teacher for her to help her with her swordsmanship skills.


The level of swordsmanship in her world is just at a whole other level compared to this world. Even the best swordsman in this world would not be anything in that world. That also meant that I couldn’t find a good teacher for her either.


Maybe someone from her world would be the best as they would also be able to teach her Haki. I had some plans, but to summon anyone decent from her world, I would need at least a kage or above level of power.


We still had some time for that but right now I had to concentrate on the things at hand.


I had other matters to attend to right now.


Three big things were coming up and I needed to prepare for those. First was my marriage to Kasumi, which was just three weeks away.


By now, we were close enough to not feel awkward about the marriage. In fact, I would actually go to war with the Stairs Daimyo if they tried to pull back now.


The second was the deal with the Uzumaki village and the upcoming attack on Uzushiogakure. Just yesterday my search on the Uzukage was completed and I found out what she was planning. Thankfully, it wasn’t anything bad. In fact, I was actually looking forward to her visit.


I wanted to make a deal with her for the location of the demons sealed in this world by the Uzumaki or other people, maybe get their help too to get them for the Soul Ritual.


As I was discovering, my soul’s strength was very essential in unlocking more of the Grimoire’s powers.


With the last two summons, I felt like I was nearing the limits to the number of summons whom I could keep with me. One or two more would be my limit as I am now.


As for how many I needed? That depended on several factors.


The summoned people were the fastest way to increase the overall power of my forces. While the training of my soldiers was going better than I had expected, it was going to take a lot of time so I had to make the most of it.


The third and last was the world travel.


I was planning to go on a ‘business tour’ after the marriage. I had already discussed everything with Kasumi and she agreed.


This move will also allow us to push back the date of the merger by a few months. We were already planning to push it till the end of the war to avoid being caught in between but this just gave us one more reason.


Once the merger happens, things will start changing and I wanted to be at least Kage level by then to face the challenges that will come right after.


The first world travel can change a lot of things and I intend to take full advantage of it.


As I was finishing, Sera appeared behind me.


“Yes Sera, what can I do for you?” I asked, without turning back, continuing to feed the mutated chakra beasts.


“Princess Kasumi has sent a message. She said that the egg you left in her care is shaking.” She reported.


This made me pause.


“Has it already started shaking?” I asked, surprised. “Alright, let’s go.”


I accompanied her towards the warehouse where Kasumi was currently staying due to her training.


I had given her the Ralts egg to care for and now that same egg was shaking, meaning it was about to hatch.


While on our way, I tried to make some small talk with Sera. “So, how’s life, Sera?” I asked, trying to think of anything I could talk to her about but failing.


She just looked at me with her same bland look. “Are you sick?”


….


“No. A bit hurt by your reply but definitely not sick.” I put a hand on my chest and acted in mock pain.


“Seriously, what’s up with you?” She asked, seriously once more, making me sigh lightly.


“I was just trying to make some jokes and small talk, you know. We don’t really talk much despite you being with us for months. I thought I could get to know you better.” I said, not making any excuses.


“Are you trying to bed me too?” She asked, making my eyes twitch.


Seriously, this girl was always straight as an arrow.


“Everyday, three times a day after breakfast, lunch and dinner.” I replied with a smile. “Everytime I eat something sweet, I can’t help but think of you and your sweet voice.”


“Don’t do that, it’s disgusting.” She scrunched her nose.


“Eh, really? I thought that line was cool. Took me a whole week to think.” I shrugged nonchalantly.


“Is that what you do? Think of lines to bed girls?” She asked, nonplussed.


“As much as I would like to do that, there are too many people who depend on me. I can’t afford to take so much time for myself. Your thoughts just happened to have caught me in my free time.” I smiled. “So, how about we get to know each other better? Tell me what you think of this world. Is it any different from your previous one?” I asked.


The only reason I was even doing this much is because she has chilled down a lot in the last month and now we were spending more time due to her helping me in my training. Knowing her more, I could see that she wasn’t rude for the sake of being rude.


It was more like her default state. She was just awkward with such things because she has never actually spent time like this.


Back in her world, things were still like in the Sengoku Period, at least for the vampire ninjas. They were trained to the bone from a very early age, leaving no time for a normal life… and very few people came out normal from such a childhood.


Sera’s case was similar. She was improving though.


“It’s… alright.” She spoke after some hesitation.


I smiled at her hesitation. It was already better than before when she would have made some rude and sarcastic comment.


“Glad that you are enjoying your time here.”


We reached the room Kasumi was staying in and entered the room to find her standing near the egg.


“Kazuya-sama!” Kasumi was the first to speak. “The egg started moving suddenly today. I didn’t know what to do.” She said looking worried.


“Nothing to worry about. It’s probably going to hatch. Let me have a look.” I went ahead and summoned my grimoire and stored it inside for a moment, reading the information. Sure enough it was going to hatch in around an hour.


After checking everything, I took it out and kept it on a cushion in front of us.


“It’s going to hatch in an hour. The egg is in perfect condition so no need to worry. In fact, we can wait for an hour for it to hatch. Meanwhile, why don’t we prepare something for the baby Ralts to eat after hatching. Actually, I haven’t eaten anything all morning either.” I said remembering.


My diet had increased a lot, perhaps due to the increased energy requirements of my body. I now ate almost five times more than what I used to eat just two years ago.


I can understand how Naruto could eat all that Ramen and not get full.


We waited and had something to eat and sure enough, around an hour later, the egg flashed white and cracked, revealing a tiny figure inside.


It had pinkish eyes peeking out from under its green bowl cut hair. A layer of its skin seemed to flow around its body like a white dress of some sort giving it a very graceful feeling and finally there were two small red horns at the front and back of its head


“Ralts!” The adorable pokemon tilted her head as she looked at us.


“Cute.”


The whisper was very soft but I was pretty sure I heard Sera say that and looked at her.


She noticed my smile and her face went back to her usual frown.


I went ahead and slowly picked up the baby Ralts.


“He’s adorable.” Kasumi said too.


“She… this one is a female.” I said. The Grimoire had told me that. “She is a Ralts. They can feel the emotions of other people and only approach those they feel good emotions from. So, don’t be angry or afraid around her. Apart from that, they are very loyal to those they consider their master, going as far as laying down their lives for them. When they grow fully, they can become incredibly powerful too.” I rubbed her cheeks and looked at her trying to hold my fingers with her tiny hands.


“Should we feed her?” Kasumi asked.


“Hmm. Get the milk.”


We had already prepared milk bottles for her.


I offered the Ralts to Kasumi so that she could feed her. She had taken care of the egg the whole time so it’s only natural that she gets the chance to do so.


In fact, with a Ralts around, she can also be protected more. She wasn’t much of a fighter and Ralts would be perfect to protect her or just teleport her out of a dangerous situation. This one already knew the Teleport move.


I saw Sera looked at the pokemon curiously, surprising since she didn’t show interest in many things.


“We need a name for her. Would you like to suggest something, Sera?” I asked, taking the girl by surprise.


“You want me to name her?” She asked.


“Hmm, why not?”


“Yes. We would love for you to name her.” Kasumi chimed in too. She knew Sera’s condition and they got along quite well in fact, I have never seen Sera act even remotely rudely towards her.


“Eucliwood Hellscythe.” She said after some thought. “It’s the name of the creator of the Vampire Ninjas. She is a very strong person. Give her this name so that she may grow as strong as her one day.”


….


That name….


“Alright. Euclidwood it is then.”


I gave them the complete set of instructions on what to feed and how to take care of the Ralts. She needed to grow a bit before we could start training her.


__________________________________x___________________________________


I waited in the same place where I had met the Uzukage last time.


Genshiro had informed me that the Uzukage had asked for a meeting.


I had already read the information about her and knew what she was planning so it wasn’t a big surprise for me.


With me were Kanae, Kuina and Saitō while Kuroka was hiding some distance away,  while Toji was hiding on a distant mountain, sniper rifle pointed this way in case something bad happened.


While I knew that the Uzukage was here with genuinely good intentions, we never knew what might happen in a negotiation.


Around fifteen minutes later, I sensed three chakra signatures approaching us and looked in the direction. Unlike the last time she was hiding her chakra and I could only identify because I knew her from the last time.


Chakra suppression techniques can be really scary. The one I used could completely erase my chakra signature and presence. It was actually something invented and used by the second Tsuchikage, Mu, something which earned him his name, meaning nothing. It was extremely hard to learn though and I was only able to get started with it because the basic version was imprinted in my mind by the Grimoire.


Toji was doing his best to learn it and I’ll be honest. That thought scares even me.


He is already extremely hard to catch. With this, he will be impossible to find for anyone except the likes of Kuroka.


Soon enough the three people appeared in front of us.


Genshiro, Rina and Mina approached them and bowed to them while I just nodded politely at her.


“Welcome to the Land of Flowers, Uzukage-sama.” I greeted her. “Please come in.”


“Prince Katsuyoshi.” She nodded before turning towards the man beside her. “This is my husband, the Daimyo of the Land of Whirlpool, Genzo Uzumaki.”


The Daimyo?


This guy?


While surprised, I didn’t let it show on my face. "Welcome to the Land of Flowers. We apologise for not recognising you.”


“Hahahaha don’t mind it. We haven’t met before and it would be surprising if you recognised us in one glance.”


We went inside the room prepared beforehand.


I was the one who initiated the conversation this time. “Congratulations on finding the new continent, Uzukage-sama.”


There was a small twitch on the corner of her lips but she controlled it immediately and bowed. “Thank you. The Land of Whirlpool and the Uzumaki Clan will forever be grateful to you because of this.”


“Please don’t do this. We did what any decent person would do for their allies.”


“No. That’s not true. Not even close allies always come to help.” The Daimyo spoke, his face showing helplessness.


I raised a questioning eyebrow and the man explained.


“Mito Uzumaki passed away two days ago.” He dropped a bomb.


…


“That’s… unfortunate.”


“Indeed. She was a very kind person.” He agreed.


“You are coming here directly from Konoha?” I asked.


“Hmm. As you already know, we are being monitored so both of us leaving at the same time was not easy. Last time Shiroyasha came to visit you, I covered for her using Clones. No one except the ones present here even knew about her visit.”


Damn…


“This time however, we had an opportunity and decided to make the most of it and visited here.”


I nodded, not knowing what to say to such a thing.


“Is Konoha?” I asked.


“It’s best for us to not expect anything from them. They are facing attacks from all four sides right now, Suna having suddenly joined the fray. Their forces are spread thin. Not that we had much expectations from the beginning.”


“We were able to talk to Mito-sama and she actually sensed our hesitation and warned us that things are going to change after she passes away. This war has been very hard on the Senju Clan. Even her grandson passed away a while ago.” The Daimyo sighed and shook his head.


“It was bound to happen.” I shook my head, making them look at me with questioning looks. “The Senju Clan were too strong. It made people afraid… both outside and inside. It was inevitable that they wouldn’t want another Hashirama or Tobirama Senju to rise from somewhere and decide to nip the problem completely.”


“You think someone from the inside was responsible for this too?” He asked, frowning.


“The first two Hokages were from the Senju Clan while the third one was given the seat just due to a word from Tobirama Senju and the support of the Senju Clan otherwise do you think with just the power of the Sarutobi Clan and Hiruzen Sarutoji’s strength back then, he would be able to become Hokage so easily?” I asked.


In my previous life, perhaps all this might have seemed to be conspiracy theories but in this life, after witnessing everything around me, it seemed the most likely case.


“If you don’t believe us, then tell us how many people from the Sarutobi Clan died in this war? Were they stronger than the Senju or the Uchiha?”


The man frowned but didn’t say anything.


“Not only that, I think outside forces, even the Daimyo of the Fire nation had a hand in all this.”


“Excuse me?” This took the man by surprise. It was understandable. Why would the Daimyo, at least the one from Fire Nation, do something like that?


“Fear is a great motivator. Isn’t that why you all are in such a condition right now?”


“That doesn’t make sense. The Senju have always been loyal to the Daimyo, not to mention their biggest supporter. Losing them would mean losing a large chunk of power.” The Uzukage denied.


“Hmm true. But here’s something you need to understand. There’s a difference between the strong and the monsters. You can fight the former but the latter makes you lose the will to fight. Hashirama Senju was someone who caught all the Tailed Beasts. Even Madara Uchiha with the Kyubi couldn't defeat him. That kind of power… it makes people apprehensive. It made even other kage shiver in their boots so can you imagine what it would do to those powerless and cowardly Daimyo?” I explained.


“Hashirama would never…”


“But what of his descendants? What if someone else became similarly powerful and didn’t have similar thoughts? What if they wanted to change the rule of the Daimyo? What if they decided to conquer the entire continent? Konoha had two such clans and a coward at the helm of the Fire Nation. He obviously cannot allow them to exist. The Uchiha were already cornered by Tobirama which left only the Senju. It was obvious they had to go. I wouldn’t be surprised if this was a deal between the five Daimyo combined?”


My words made them go quiet.


“Thankfully, it seems that Tobirama Senju was indeed a wise man and had prepared for this too.” I added catching them by surprise.


“What?”


I smiled. “Tobirama knew the Senju Clan were going to be targeted heavily till they went extinct and prepared for the eventualities. He, during his term as a Hokage, actually orchestrated fake deaths of several members of the Senju Clan, spreading them across the elemental nations, both as spies of the Senju Clan… and a way to continue the continued bloodline of the Senju… under other names. The fact that no one knew of this already tells us how much he trusted the other people under him.”


“Are you serious?” the Uzukage asked, seriously.


“Oh very. In fact, we even know the descendants of one of these people. That’s how we found out about the whole scheme. Truly, one can never be too careful.”


“Who?” She asked.


“We apologise for not being able to tell you the identity of the person without their permission but the person is the grandchild of Tōka Senju if you wish to know.”


“Tōka-sama’s grandchild!”


“Oh, you know Tōka Senju?” I asked, surprised by her reaction.


“Yes. Who doesn’t? She was one of Hashirama Senju’s closest aides. In fact, she was married to one of our Uzumaki Clan members too, an uncle of mine.The person was actually Genshiro’s elder brother. He had gone to Konoha as Mito-sama’s aide.”


Now this took me by surprise. Even Genshiro was looking stunned at the reveal.


“We had heard that Yuka Senju, her daughter, passed away on a mission.” Genshiro said, looking genuinely sad.


“This is indeed a small world. As for Yuka Senju, no, she didn’t die but rather went undercover where she got involved with a guy and had a child. She was suffering from an illness and passed away shortly afterwards.”


“Could you please tell us the identity of the person, Your Highness?” He asked, expectantly.


“Again, we apologise. We would need to ask the person in question first but we promise to inform you as soon as we get the permission.” I assured him.


I will have to check his information first and then ask Kasumi if she wants to meet him.


“Thank you, Your Highness.”


“At least, we got to hear one good news today.” The Whirlpool Daimyo smiled. “And we have to thank you for this again.”


“Too bad we didn’t have the foresight of Tobirama Senju to prepare for all this beforehand.” The Uzukage sighed.


“Let’s do what we can do now.” Genzo put a hand assuringly on her shoulder, making her nod.


They had a good chemistry.


I can see how they ruled the Land of Whirlpools like this.


“So, will the Uzumaki be moving?” I asked.


“Yes. The lives of our people matter more to us than a piece of land. Although some of the old ones want to stay back. Those stubborn fools.”


“They are really serious about it?” Genshiro asked and the Uzukage nodded in response.


“They plan to stay back to cover for us till the last moment.” She explained the decision of the old ones in the Uzushiogakure village.


“For them it’s taking their home from them… although we believe that without a family inside, four walls only make a house, not a home. A real home is where our loved ones live.”


“How do you explain that to those people? They want to put up a last stand against the attackers. I have tried everything to convince them but they have already made up their minds. One thing you should understand about Uzumaki is that once we make up our mind, it’s nigh impossible to change it.” The Whirlpool Daimyo said.


“Let’s let them do what they want. The purpose of our visit here today is to keep our side of the bargain.” The Uzukage said, bringing up the topic of business.


Both of them looked at me. “The information given by you was verified. The continent is indeed habitable. The residents of that place don’t even know about chakra so we can probably establish ourselves there without much danger too. It’s the best place we could have asked for. Since that’s the case, we have come here to complete our side of the bargain too. We will be sending three Seal Masters from our Clan to stay here and teach you and your people, all our knowledge as a sign of our alliance and gratitude.”


Wait, they didn’t know about chakra?


I didn’t know that.


In fact, I didn’t know anything about that continent except the location.


Maybe I should send people there and see if I can discover some resources too.


“Thank you.” I bowed, not rejecting their offer this time.


“Secondly, I propose a marriage between Rina and Mina with you to solidify the alliance between the Land of Flowers and the Uzumaki Clan.”


“Wait, both of them?!”


The woman just shrugged. “I asked them and it was their suggestion. Ask them if you want to know the reason.”


I looked at the two and it was Rina who spoke. “We have lived with each other our entire lives and shared everything. We do not wish to get separated. I apologise for asking this of Your Highness. If you don’t like this, we will accept your decision.”


I tried to find some words but nothing came to my mind.


“Oh come on. It’s not like you don’t have more than one girl in your life already.” The Uzukage rolled her eyes. “Be a man.”


Her husband just coughed at her words.


“Sigh… are you both sure you want this?” I asked the two girls.


“Yes. This is something we had decided a long time ago.” Rina said. “We either marry one person or not marry at all.”


…


I took a look at Kanae who was also surprised at their words and looked at me but nodded when our eyes met.


“Okay. I accept.”


“Good. Now, on to another topic. We were hoping you could assist us with something.” The Whirlpool Daimyo said.


I was still distracted by the whole twin thing and brought out a scroll from my pocket. “Here are enough supplies for three thousand people for three months.”


The guy looked at me in surprise but I pretended like it was nothing. I had a plan.


“Ah… well, isn’t this what you wanted?” I asked.


“Yes but… how did you know?”


“...we have our sources.” I shrugged.


The man took the hint and didn’t say anything but kept the scroll. “Thank you. I will send the payment for this soon.”


“You don’t need to. This is just some help from us. Instead, we were hoping to exchange some information if you could help us.”


“Information? Sure, anything.”


“We have heard that the Uzumaki Clan knows about the location of many sealed beings, like Demons and strong beasts throughout the continent. We wish to know about any such being, even rumours are fine.”


“Are you perhaps… planning to use them as weapons?” The Uzukage asked. “While Jinchuriki are not rare, those creatures are not like tailed beasts.”


“We know. We do not plan on making any jinchuriki. We are planning on using them to power the barriers around the cities. As for them being dangerous, we have methods of completely destroying them if push comes to shove so you don’t need to worry.”


“Using them as chakra sources to power barriers? You can always use people to power the barrier, you know.”


“We have our reasons. Still, if you are worried about us making Jinchuriki, you can rest assured. That’s the last thing we would ever do.”


“Oh, are you not attracted by their power? In fact, if we had made the deal with Hashirama back in the day and possessed a Jinchuriki of our own, perhaps other nations would have thought twice before attacking us.” The Uzukage said.


“We do not wish to make any jinchuriki.” I stopped her words in between. “In fact, while we respect Hashirama Senju, what he did with the Tailed Beasts… was disgusting. To use them as bargaining chips, selling them… for anyone else, it would have been different but not him or Madara.” I shook my head.


My words caught them off guard too so I decided to give them some insight about this world. Who knows what the Black Zetsu might pull. It’s never bad to have some more people in on this, especially people who are so adept in the art of fuinjutsu.


I had thought long and hard about this and the Uzumaki Clan were an essential part of my plans. Here goes nothing…


“Tell me Uzukage-sama, what do you know of the history of the Uzumaki Clan?” I asked.


“Huh? Are you asking me what I know of my clan?”


“Yes. What do you know about the history, the beginning of the Uzumaki Clan?” I asked.


“Our Uzumaki Clan began as a branch of the Senju Clan around three hundred and eighty years ago when they settled in the Land of Whirlpool to concentrate on our Fuinjutsu rather than fight continuous wars like the Senju. From there, we made our own name based on the whirlpools surrounding our village and came to be known as the Uzumaki Clan.”


“What about before that? Do you know about the beginning of the Senju Clan?” I asked.


She shook her head and I spoke.


“The Senju Clan was formed by a man called Asura Otsutsuki. He lived with his father and elder brother where he was taught about chakra and ninshu. He was quite dull compared to his brother who was a veritable genius. His elder brother was the one who created the twelve hindsigns to more easily manipulate chakra, giving birth to Ninjutsu.” I revealed to their utter surprise.


“Later on, his father sent both of them out on a test to determine his successor but ultimately chose his younger son because the older one didn’t consider other people and always relied on his own strength to solve all problems, always preferring to walk alone while the younger always took others together.”


“As a good leader should.” The Whirlpool Daimyo said and I nodded.


“Unfortunately this would lead the two brothers to war… several times after their father passed away. That war had continued till the formation of the Konoha village. Can you guess who the descendants of the elder brother were?”


I saw their faces go pale. “Uchiha.”


“Exactly. As a reward, we will let you know who their father was. His name was Hagoromo Otsutsuki but the whole world knows of him as The Sage of Six Paths.”


“What?!”


“The elder brother inherited the eyes of the sage while the younger inherited his body and chakra. That’s why the Senju have such insanely strong bodies while the Uchiha have the Sharingan. It’s funny right. The whole world calls them Jutsu thieves and yet the whole world copied Indra to even know how to use ninjutsu?”


I laughed at it. Such an irony.


“Anyways, the war between the brothers didn’t end there. Their chakra repeatedly incarnates in their descendants, continuing the war. The most prominent figures among the two clans are more often the incarnations of the two brothers, the last ones being… well you can take a guess.”


I let them understand the situation.


“Now, the reason why we are so mad is because Hashirama, that fool, actually subdued the Tailed Beasts, nine beings created by the Sage of Six Paths himself and sold them as cheap goods. The Sage called them his children. In a way, they would be siblings and he, that dumb moron, sold them like cattle.”


The look of shock was evident on their faces.


“How… how do you even know all this? How should we even…”


“While We do not claim to be all knowing, there are many things about this world that We know. We can understand if you don’t believe us. You can talk to any tailed beast. All of them are intelligent creatures. They were originally the part of a completely different beast, called the Ten Tails, something which had almost caused the destruction of all life on this world. It was defeated by the Sage and his brother and sealed inside his body, making him the first Jinchuriki. Later on, he divided its chakra into nine pieces and thus the nine tailed beasts were born. Each of them has a name. If you talk to them, just use the Sage’s name and they will at least listen to you. So, if you ever have a chance, help those poor fellows out. They are not inherently bad.”


All the people in the room were quiet at this point and the Whirlpool Daimyo broke the silence after a while.


“You have given us some life changing information. We require some time to think about it. It’s too much for us to take. It just sounds too unbelievable.”

She nodded towards the monk and led them to an empty room and took seats.


“What kind of enemy could do this? I know there are rumours of a gigantic dragon hundreds of kilometres long and actual Gods are flying around everywhere. Each story is more ridiculous than the others. I know there was a big fight… the missing Hokage Mountain is a dead giveaway but I want to know what exactly is going on.”


She looked at him strangely. “Who told you those were rumours?”


“Huh?”


Over the next hour, she went and explained everything she knew to them and by the end of the hour, they were just as flabbergasted by the whole thing as anyone who had heard it later.


“You can’t be serious. Please tell me you are not serious.”


“Trust me, Asuma. I have many better things to do than to joke around here.”


“But Gods… are you sure?” The Monk asked, the look on his face was of terror.


His entire belief must have been shaken.


“I did hear the dragon say that the one who broke the moon to fix the land… was a Goddess.” She had been close enough to hear bits of their words. Now she wished she hadn’t been.


At least now they know the extent of their fuck up.


“Not only that but there was another guy, the one who stopped everything and froze the water from the ocean. We later found from our investigation that the entire trench, up till  the ocean was frozen by him… almost instantly. The dragon called him Boss.”


- Fourth Raikage A -


“Did you find anything?” He asked as soon as Mabui entered his office.


She nodded and handed him the report from the Land of Fire.


He quickly flipped the pages of the file and checked the information. After a few minutes, he looked up with a frown on his face.


“Is this some kind of a joke?”


“As much as I want it to be, no. This is the exact news I have received from several of our spies in the Land of Fire and Konoha.”


“A dozens of kilometres long dragon? A God? And a trench which connected Konoha to the ocean. What kind of nonsense is this? I want information of what secret weapon they are using, not a story from the drunk fantasies of the taverns from the Land of Fire.”


“Do you really think it’s nonsense? Even after seeing what happened to the moon?” Mabui replied and he found his retort getting stuck into his mouth.


“It had to be a genjutsu. That… that kind of power is not real. It cannot be real.”


“And yet it is. Even according to the legends, the moon was created by the Sage of Six Paths. If that is so then I don’t think what we saw was really a genjutsu.”


He clenched his hands and looked at the file in front of him as if it was some kind of curse.


“Can it… is it really true? Are there really Gods in this world?”


“Who knows? But there are certainly beings with godlike powers… and Konoha has provoked several of them.”


He looked blankly at the table and went in thought.


A part of his mind wondered what kind of beings they were and if they were beings like Tailed Beasts and if that was so, could they be captured and used for Kumogakure?


Then he remembered their powers and pushed those thoughts away.


No.


Against that kind of power, they would have no other choice but to die.


That was the freaking moon, dammit.


The moon!


“A-sama. Konoha is extremely weak right now. Should we… should we prepare for a war? We could use this opportunity…”


Yes… what is the situation in Konoha right now?


“No. Wait till we have the full details of the situation. Find everything. Who were those people? Where did they come from? Why did they attack Konoha? How did Konoha survive such an attack? If they can indeed survive such an attack, they might have some trump cards of their own. What if they sealed such a monster into a Jinchuriki? Send more people near the borders and test them but don’t attack them outright. Take advantage of this situation to infiltrate the Land of Fire and find out all the details. That old bastard Onoki will also be looking for a chance. Let them make a move first.”


He quickly gave commands to make them move.


The incident had left everyone in shock and fear. It was his duty as the kage to ensure that his people remained calm.


- Konan -


“What are we going to do, Nagato? Are there really Gods in this world?” She asked, trepidation showing in her voice.


Nagato has been unnaturally quiet since hearing the report about the incident in Konoha village.


She didn’t disturb him either because she knew how worried he would be in such a situation. The news had been just that shocking and even she had a hard time believing it… even after seeing the moon collapse in front of her own eyes.


“It… doesn’t matter.”


“Eh?”


“It doesn’t matter if there are Gods in this world. They aren’t doing their job well either way.” Nagato continued.


Konan looked at him surprised but he was looking down at the floor as he continued.


“If they were really doing their jobs then there wouldn’t be all this pain in the world. But they aren’t, so… it’s time they stepped aside.” He looked up and there was a craze in his eyes unlike anything before. “If there are such cruel and sadistic Gods in this world who would take pleasure in seeing the pain of people… then I am going to bring them down.”


“Nagato!”


“No Konan… I am Pain… I am the pain of every person who has been suffering in this cruel world. The suffering which those so-called Gods have subjected us to… it’s about time they knew Pain…”


“You can’t be serious. Didn’t you read the reports? Didn’t you see the moon crumbling apart?” She tried to reason.


“The moon was created by the Sage of Six Paths and the destruction they cause could be done if we can collect all the Tailed Beasts. I… can do it. With these eyes of mine. Perhaps, this is the reason I have been given these eyes… to bring those cruel Gods down and make them know pain…”


Konan looked at him with wide eyes and tried to reason with him but no matter what, he wasn’t ready to listen.


At this point, she didn’t even know what to do anymore.


- Fugaku Uchiha -


He opened his eyes and the world became clear again.


“Are there any problems?” Mikoto asked and he activated his Sharingan.


The power which flowed in his eyes… it felt much stronger than before. In fact, he himself felt far stronger than before. His chakra had risen. His vision was sharper. His power flowed much smoother.


He looked at a mirror on the side of the room and pushed more power into his eyes. His eyes changed… morphing into a six cornered star pattern, different from his three cornered star pattern before.


The eyes of undying light, the Eternal Mangekyo Sharingan…


Even through the mirror, he could feel the power in those eyes…


Mikoto quickly checked a few more things and finally let out a sigh of relief. “Everything seems to be fine.”


He nodded. “How are things outside? What was happening outside while I was unconscious.” He asked.


She nodded and reported everything.


“Today is a meeting of the council. Everyone wants to know what we have unearthed from our investigations.”


“I see. Okay, I will attend it.” He got up and looked at Mikoto who hesitated a bit. “What is it?”


“Fugaku… Itachi… he is… ill.”


“Hmm?”


“When Tsunade-sama was treating him, she discovered that he had a serious illness in his lungs. It could become terminal if not treated soon.”


He paused at the news while she continued.


“Tsunade-sama told me that I could verify the news from other doctors if I doubted her. I did. It was true. I…”


“Ask Tsunade what she wants. Get him the best treatment available.” He interrupted.


Mitoko looked at him in surprise and he winced.


“Do you really think I don’t care about him?” He asked, breaking her surprise. He shook his head. “The reason I am doing this is to show him the true face of the people he was siding with. Those eyes… I gave them to him for a reason.”


The power of those eyes… he knew the temptation and fear they carried. Even he himself wasn’t unaffected. But that’s why he gave them to Itachi…


Let him see the same people he was willing to betray his family for, turn against him due to those eyes… because there was no way anyone would allow such a power to keep on existing.


As for him using those eyes on the Clan… even if he were to somehow bypass the cooldown period of the technique, it would be for the best that he doesn’t use it… at least that way he can keep using those Mangekyo again.

   
He had sealed a technique in those eyes that would destroy them if the user ever tried to use Kotoamatsukami. But even without that technique, a pair of Mangekyo Sharingan was very strong. Just the normal Genjutsu capability and perception boost from it was far beyond a normal Sharingan not to mention the Susanno…


Fugaku didn’t hate his son… but that didn’t mean he wasn’t disappointed. It chilled his heart to think what could have happened if this whole incident hadn’t happened. His son had really gone astray… and it was a father’s duty to show his son the right path.


- Jiraiya -


He sat in the corner of the room, waiting for everyone to gather for the meeting.


Today was the day the Uchiha Clan was going to disclose the results of their investigations of the whole incident.


One by one, people filled the room.


Jiraiya was sure his sensei was getting removed from his position as Hokage… probably the first kage to be ousted from their position in the history of the Elemental Nations. Sigh…


He looked at the picture of Minato on the wall… which had been replaced after the last one was taken by Naruto…


How would he feel if he were here now?


Jiraiya’s mind has been in turmoil… especially since he was summoned to Mt. Myoboku by the Toad Sages.


Somehow the Prophecy he was chasing all this time… was void.


It was shattered and the Great Toad Sage had another dream. In this dream, he saw a figure with icy blue eyes and black hair. He stood in the midst of a frozen world. Even the lines of fates which approached him were being sliced to pieces.


The description only reminded Jiraiya of one person.


The Great Toad Sage has been in a critical situation since he saw that vision. Apparently, even just a glimpse of that person had injured his spirit greatly…


Just what kind of beings did they get involved with this time?


Suddenly, Jiraiya was left with nothing…


He had lost his friend, lost his student and was probably going to lose his sensei too. He was really at a loss at what to do.


Before he could think more, the door opened and Asuma Sarutobi entered the room. Behind him was the Fire Daimyo himself along with the rest of his Guardians.


Everyone stood up and headed to meet the Daimyo.


“Jiraiya, Tsunade… so glad you both are here to take care of things. How did such a thing happen? Just what…”


“We are about to discuss exactly that, Daimyo-sama. The Uchiha Clan is about to present their report.” Tsunade replied.


“Good… in that case, we would like to witness it too.”


She nodded and offered him a seat at the head of the table.


Just a minute later, Fugaku Uchiha opened the door and entered with several of his clansmen following him.


He looked at the Daimyo with surprise and bowed slightly before looking at Tsunade.


“Let the meeting begin. I think we all already know of the incident which happened a week ago but I would still like to jog everyone’s memory and report everything from my point of view.” Tsunade stood up and addressed the meeting and basically recalled everything she had seen that day.


He saw the Daimyo’s face paling at Tsunade’s story.


“The attack was done because they had tried to prevent Naruto Uzumaki, who is presumed to have been the contractor of the Dragons from returning back to their realm against his will. The first attacks were made by Danzo Shimura at the green dragon and then towards Naruto Uzumaki and another child who was also a dragon. Their attack was a retaliation. Later on, the destruction of the Hokage Mountain and the… final attack which made the… countrywide trench was done because Danzo Shimura had tried to use his stolen Sharingan to take control of the two dragons.”


“What did they want, Tsunade? How did you all stop them and send them back?” The Fire Daimyo asked.


They winced.


“We didn’t send them back… They left of their own will… on the condition that we will leave Naruto Uzumaki alone from now on. From their discussions, I could understand that the leader of the group considers Naruto as an adopted brother of his. He found out about the way Naruto was treated and Naruto has been staying there with them since then. This time Naruto had discovered his heritage and had come to take the picture of his parents from Konoha when he was stopped by the third Hokage… and the rest you all know. As for how we stopped them? We didn’t. Their leader didn’t want a fight from the start. He had even ordered them to not attack anyone unless they were attacked first… which they were. Even during the whole battle, they only retaliated when attacked first.”


“So… they left? Just like that?” the Fire Daimyo asked, astonished.


“Yes.”


“Do we know where they came from? Where is this Summoning Land of Dragons? I have never heard of dragons as summons before in my life, even in the old scrolls of the Hyuga Clan.” Hiashi Hyuga asked.


“No one knew they existed before this. Not even the Toads of Mount Myoboku or Lady Katsuyu of Shikkotsu forest knew of them existing. We think they live in a completely different world separate from ours and Naruto was able to accidentally reverse summon himself there.”


“So… you are trying to say that all of this was just a big coincidence?” Shikaku Nara asked, sarcastically.


“No. The attack itself was due to the hasty decisions of Hiruzen Sarutobi and his advisors.” Fugaku Uchiha spoke for the first time, getting everyone’s attention.


“As Tsunade-sama stated just now… they had only attacked in retaliation. Moreover, their entire reason for getting angry was the unfair treatment of Naruto Uzumaki. What Tsunade-sama missed to mention was that they had called Naruto Uzumaki a possession and weapon of the village, further provoking the ire of the dragons and then attacked the green dragon girl first.” That was something Jiraiya hated too but he hadn’t said anything back then.


From an objective point of view, not losing the jinchuriki of the village was a priority task but Jiraiya knew that today people were not here to logically look at things but rather to find a scapegoat to blame everything on and sensei and his advisors… were just too convenient to pass up.


Sigh… he was right to stay away from all this politics.


Fugaku continued. “This matter would have never arisen had they done their work properly and treated Naruto Uzumaki as the Fourth wanted him to be treated. Even then, there was a chance that things wouldn’t have escalated to this degree if they hadn’t attacked first and tried to negotiate with a non-violent enemy first. That way, not only could we have the village’s jinchuriki back but also gained the support of such… powerful beings.”


“Is… is there no way to reconcile with them?” The Fire Daimyo asked meekly.


Tsunade shook his head. “We don’t know where they came from and where they went to. Naruto was… very lucky.” She then looked at Fugaku. “Do you have the reports?”


He nodded and put forward a scroll and unsealed it.


Several dozen files appeared on the table and he passed them over to every member on the table, including the Daimyo.


“Danzo Shimura, an advisor of the Hokage and the leader of a secret branch of anbu under his direct control called the root has been involved in too many things. The files in front of you contain the information about whatever we could find about him. Too bad he died and his body was destroyed or we could have the Yamanaka check through their memories to find the true extent of the damages he has caused.” Fugaku began as they all opened the files and began pursuing the contents.


The more he looked the deeper the frown on his face became.


Human Experiments, dealing with Orochimaru, kidnapping and assassinating members of Konoha Clans for techniques and kekkei genkai, colluding with nuke nin of other villages, looting villages and merchants to fund their missions, threatening orphanages to recruit. The root training regime and graduation test made him disgusted… was this the Konoha they preached about?


Was this the Will of Fire?


And Sensei was allowing all this to happen?


At this point, even Jiraiya couldn’t ignore the mistakes of his sensei… this was just too much.


The further he read, the more disgusted he became.


Sabotaging people, spreading false rumours and propaganda… Apparently it was them who had spread the information about Naruto being the reincarnation of the fox and sensei had tried to cover it up as him honouring Minato’s last wish…


That bastard was also involved in some shady deals during the nine tails attack and had been constantly spreading rumours about the Uchiha Clan in the village.


“In fact, these are only the things that we were able to find out from our investigation. With the help of a thorough search from the Yamanaka Clan, we can discover even more information from their minds.” Fugaku completed, remarkably keeping himself in control. Especially considering the fact that the death of Shisui Uchiha was caused by Danzo Shimura according to the reports.


“H-how can this be happening in Konoha?” The Fire Daimyo started. “Did Hiruzen know about this?”


“If he did then he was as guilty as Danzo Shimura for letting this happen and if he didn’t know anything was amiss, then he is clearly not competent enough to sit in his position anymore. As for what he is, you will have to ask him by yourself, Lord Daimyo.” Jiraiya felt bad but looked around and found that no one said anything to refute it.


“Either way, from what I have heard, he is not fit to continue as a Hokage after losing his arm and leg. The village has lost many ninjas, so soon after the Nine Tails attack. We have even lost the fourth, Orochimaru has rebelled and now this, not to mention the jinchuriki of the village has been taken by… Gods. We are in an incredibly dire situation right now with the other villages eying us. We need to elect a new Hokage as soon as possible and stabilise the situation.” Surprisingly, it was Hiashi Hyuga who said this.


Jiraiya knew he wasn’t wrong either but tried to remember and recalled the incident of the Kumo Head Ninja where Hiashi’s brother was sacrificed.


While he understood that it was the best possible choice, trading the life of one person for the like for hundreds in a potential war, especially right after the nine tails attack, he could also understand Hiashi’s anger with sensei about it, although the Hyuga Clan head was too good to show such a thing to anyone.


“Yes yes… then who is to become the next Hokage?” The Daimyo questioned.


“I propose Jiraiya-sama.”


“I think Tsunade-sama should take the seat. She is the granddaughter of the First and the grandniece of the Second, not to mention one of the Sannin. The village would regain its morale if she were to take the helm.”


Jiraiya raised his hand. “I do not wish to stand in the contest. My Spy Network needs me outside the village, more so now than before.”


“But that’s…”


At this time Tsunade also raised her hand. “I do not wish to take the position either but I recommend Fugaku Uchiha. The Uchiha Clan has been treated unfairly but even then has continued to contribute to the village. Fugaku and his son Itachi have been major contributors in the previous battle and he is more than capable of taking the position of the Hokage. In case everyone has forgotten, the Uchiha were one of the founders of the village too. Anyways, we can vote.”


Sure enough there were some doubts in the people while some didn’t agree with the choice but the vote cleared everything.


The only one who could stand in competition was Kakashi but he had been running around, weeding out spies.


Guy hadn’t been in the village during the attack. When he returned he was immediately sent out on another mission, not that anyone would recommend him as the Hokage.


Shikaku Nara directly pulled back.


In the end, only Hiashi Hyuga and Fugaku Uchiha were left.


And so… Fugaku Uchiha became the fifth Hokage of Konohagakure.


- Kaguya Otsutsuki -


Where was she?


She tried to remember and the last thing she could remember was being sealed by Hagoromo and Hamura and leaving her will behind to free her at a later time.


The following years were just her, powerless, all alone, trapped in eternal darkness.


Then there was a sudden shaking. She felt the seal being cracked open but unlike what she was expecting, it wasn’t Zetsu who had freed her but rather, her seal being broken down by someone. The next thing she knew, she was buried in the ground below.


Her form was that of a spirit who couldn’t wander further away from her place.


She had no body and even her spirit was weak, almost fading due to the long period of sealing. She didn’t even have any chakra.


Right now, what she needed the most… was a body to latch on to so that she doesn’t fade away.


She soon felt a life nearby and quickly forced her spirit to move and latch onto it before she lost consciousness.


The last thing she remembered before losing her consciousness was seeing the towering figure of a girl… and Byakugan.


- Hiashi Hyuga -


“How could that happen? Fugaku Uchiha, the new Hokage?” The elders clamoured between one another.


Their pride had been hurt when their biggest rival, the Uchiha had become a hokage.


Normally, this would have been impossible.


Every Clan Head knew how the Uchiha were treated by the upper management of the village, not to mention how the selection of the hokage happened.


It was always someone from the Hokage line.


From First Hokage to the Second, then Third and even the fourth was the student of the Third’s student.


Even last time, the only recommendations for the position of the Hokage were Orochimaru and Minato, both people related to the Third Hokage…


If some gained a strength and reputation comparable to them but wasn’t from the same line… they were removed.


A prime example would be Sakumo Hatake… or how could the information about such an important mission become public knowledge?


Everyone knew what was happening but no one interfered, afraid of facing the same end as the White Fang.


So, an Uchiha becoming the Hokage was the last thing anyone could imagine, especially after the Nine Tails fiasco… but who could have thought?


In the end, Hiashi’s name was given just so there was some competition. With Tsunade and Jiraiya backing away, and Tsunade recommending Fugaku, his ascension was all but decided. The Fire Daimyo was also in a hurry and quickly agreed to this.


But what surprised Hiashi was what happened later.


Fugaku Uchiha’s first decision as the Hokage was to strip the elder council of their position and have them searched thoroughly by the Yamanaka.


If they found anything awry, the search would then move to Hiruzen Sarutobi too. Everyone knew they would find something, after all, they had been at the top for several decades. It would be a miracle if they hadn’t done shady things, especially with Danzo and Orochimaru running around.


The only relief for Sarutobi was that the investigation’s results will not be made public so as to not cause too much chaos in the village during this time.


Now if that first decision was expected, the next one was completely out of the blue.


Fugaku Uchiha selected his new council and while many if not most expected him to choose from his own clan, he actually chose Tsunade, Shikaku and… him…


Yes… the Uchiha Clan head had chosen his clan’s biggest rival’s head as an advisor.


Third was the decision of dividing the duties.


Uchiha had always managed the Police Force alone. This had always put them at odds with the Konoha civilians. To reduce this, he had opened the police force to other clans.


The Hyuga were chosen for this as their Byukagan could help monitor the village just as well as the Sharingan could.


With just this small move, Fugaku showed people that he was not favouring his clan and actually taking power away from them whereas what it did was share their burden with other clans, removing the Uchiha as the sole target of the public’s ire when law was enforced.


As for taking away the power, Hiashi was sure the Anbu’s composition would change soon enough so no hair was lost on their heads.


It even made Hiashi doubt if the position of the Hokage suddenly made everyone a better politician because these were not things he could have expected from the previous Fugaku.


Perhaps the… Gods did knock some sense into him while beating him up?


Yes, Gods…


It was something Tsunade had heard herself and after the show of power… no one doubted it either.


The purpose of the Fire Daimyo coming here… was to make Shrines to appease the wrath of the Gods…


Apparently, one of the people investigating the incident from his court was also a member of the Fire Temple.


Safe to say the monk was beyond appalled at the news that actual Gods had descended and punished Konoha…


They were currently having the shrines constructed in place of the Hokage Mountain as a show of their apology.


The Fire Daimyo himself wanted to inaugurate the shrine in a festival while the monks from the Fire Temple had been called to offer prayers there.


Hiashi and the Hyuga Clan were in charge of this entire operation and he had sent his assistant, Haru Hyuga with his daughter Hinata to check the location before the construction could begin.


As the meeting finished, he stepped out of the room and saw his daughter who had returned, carrying… a bunny.


Sigh… Hinata… he was always worried about what she might face if she continued to be so kind.


Perhaps, his new position could allow him to somehow change the age-old traditions of his clan.


After all, if an Uchiha could become the Hokage… there was no way the Hyuga couldn’t change.


- Omake (Alternate End)(Crack) -


“Sensei, there is no way normal ninjas can stand up to them. We need to do something.”


Hiruzen looked at the girl floating in the sky who was giving off a pressure far surpassing that of the dragon above and decided that he needed to do something.


At that point, he could only think of one jutsu which had any chance to stop them.


So taking one last breath he prepared himself.


He had committed many mistakes and now was his chance to correct them so he didn’t hesitate. He made the hand seals for the jutsu.


"When the tree leaves dance, one shall find flames. The fire's shadow will illuminate the village, and once again, tree leaves shall bud anew.”


“Sensei, no!” He heard Jiraiya’s shout. He must have figured out what he was about to do but Hiruzen didn’t waver.


Suddenly he felt a chill run down his back as the jutsu took effect.


He rushed the girl who merely looked at him without making any moves.


“Shiki Fuin!”


A translucent figure appeared in front of him. It was a gaunt spectre with a demonic visage. It was much larger than an average human, possessing long, shaggy, white hair, from which two red horns protruded, as well as purple-hued skin. It was draped in a large white kimono and carried a set of prayer beads and a sword in his hand.


Hiruzen concentrated on the person he wanted to seal and the figure moved but rather than attacking the girl… it sheathed back his sword and then looked back.


A severe chill ran down Hiruzen’s spine when he was started by the blank dark eyes of the figure.


Then it spoke…


What!


It spoke…


“You want to seal her?”


The words sent shivers down Hiruzen’s very soul but he nodded nonetheless.


…


The Shinigami and the girl both stared at him for a while and Hiruzen’s mind and heart were running over their capacity… when the Shinigami opened his mouth again.


“You nuts, bruh…”


“Huh?”


With that the Shinigami disappeared again.


Hiruzen on the other hand looked at the girl and the next second, he was embedded into the ground… an arm and leg mangled beyond recognition…


But beyond the pain, only one thought ran in his mind.


What just happened?

title: Drawn to Power: Chapter 8: Daily Life of a Secret Mangaka
content:
Drawn to Power


Disclaimer: I own nothing


Chapter 8: Daily Life of a Secret Mangaka


___________________________________________________________________


- Tatsuya -


I returned to the hotel I was staying at late in the morning. My Shadow Clone was still there, keeping a guard.


I dispelled it when I entered the room and laid on the bed.


The result of the fight was as I had expected after all, I wasn’t expecting to defeat the Lord of the youkai with just a year or two of training. It was the process which surprised me.


He won with an illusion magic… no, yojutsu.


The man had explained the difference between the different types of powers used by the Youkai. Nurarihyon’s illusion was his personal, unique fear or the yojutsu which runs in his bloodline.


So many different styles of magic and each having their own advantages and weaknesses. It just goes to show how vast this world truly is.


Inside the house, I entered the Training Dimension.


I was not in the mood to summon Shanks. That guy would keep on teasing me the entire time. Same for Tobirama, who would keep on scolding me.


Itachi might not look like it but he was pretty savage in his comments too.


Hmm, Hashirama it is.


I summoned him and told him about the training and spar with Nurarihyon. Even the things he told me about the Senjutsu of this world.


“Oh, is there such a thing? I didn’t know that was possible. Manipulating Nature’s Energy directly to do things sounds fantastic. I can think of several things which would give it an advantage over our Senjutsu style. At the same time, there are things our Senjutsu style can have an advantage in.”


“Like?”


“Hmm, since you directly manipulate Nature's Energy, you don’t have to go through the complex process of taking in Nature's Energy, mixing it in equal proportion of Physical Energy and Spiritual Energy to make Senjutsu Chakra, thus eliminating the dangers associated with it. Even the time needed will be reduced depending on your mastery of the skill. Finally, you won’t be limited to ten minutes of Sage Mode since it wouldn’t just end with you using up all of your Senjuutsu Chakra.” He said after some thought. “This way, you can use the power for as long as you are not down.”


And the disadvantages?


“Let’s see. I would have to see it in use to know exactly but I would say, you would need a strong body and affinity with Nature’s Energy to manipulate Nature’s Energy to that extent. Second, it could be weaker at initial stages compared to Sage Mode since you get added Physical Energy and Spiritual Energy on top of the Nature’s Energy. She took a seat while I got the manuscript. In the meantime, Tobi got her some tea.


“This is good. We can directly print it as always. Sigh… you really make our work too easy, Tatsuya-kun. Sometimes I feel we are not working hard enough.”


“You all have a lot on your plate as it is. Just take a break once in a while. How have the sales been going though?”


“It’s nice overall. Your manga along with Shinobu-sensei’s manga are carrying the Magazine right now. We need more good manga, at least two more of them to establish a solid foothold.”


Her words gave me an idea.


“Actually…”


“Hmm?”


“Well, if you don’t mind, I have an idea.”


She nodded.


“You see, I just completed Maid-sama today. A total of eighty three chapters and one extra.” I said and saw her look at me dumbfoundedly. “I was wondering if I can submit another manga to the Magazine?”


“Another one? Are you sure you can do that?”


“Well… I have some free time so I don’t see why not. I will need some time.”


“Obviously, take as much time as you need. I will have to inspect your work first though.” She said, clearly happy. “Just understand that I will have to put it on hold if your health or the quality of the manga falls.”


“You don’t need to worry about that. I won’t let any such thing happen.”


“Okay then. I will check the new manuscript when it’s done.”


“Do you have any requirements for what kind of manga you want?” I asked.


“Hmm, right now we are mainly dealing with Shoujo Manga to appease a certain demographic. One more of those could be good. It would help us make a foothold in this genre. We can expand later.”


“Alright. I will give you a new manuscript in a week.”


A Shoujo Manga… I had one in mind.


Kimi ni Todoke, something I had already rolled would be perfect for this.


It’s one of the best stories out there, having sold millions of copies in my previous life for a very good reason.


“Good.”


She talked to me for a while and left with the manuscript while I went back to my room.


I needed to use the gacha.


Hope I get something good this time.


I spun the wheel and one of the tickets disappeared from my hand.


The wheel stopped at… Beelzebub.


That action comedy manga?


I think it had magic too but I don’t remember everything about it. I might check it later on. Let’s see the last roll.


The wheel rolled again, slowing down and stopping at… Inuyasha.


Fuck Yeah!!!


This is what I was talking about.


I had realised something very important in the past few years.


The stronger the people, the more points I get.


Even the people in the Supernatural World read manga. But my manga was not targeting them before. Demon Slayer manga was not that famous in the Supernatural World while Naruto was. This was because the Supernatural world was more interested in things they could associate with.


I wanted to make something centred around the Supernatural world to attract readers from that part.


Inuyasha was perfect for it.


I could actually have Rikuo promote it and gain readers among youkai at least.


Even the powers in the world were nice and while a lot of them required and were youkai based powers, I knew things I could use too.


Kikyo was very good at purification and healing. She also used Spiritual Powers so maybe she could help me train in that art. 


There was also the Shikon Jewel and the swords but I didn’t know if I could use those without youkai powers.


Demon Slayer has been for almost three years already. It will be over in one more year and I would get a chance to introduce one more manga. In that time, I can complete Kimi ni Todoke and even start Inuyasha.


It will be a proper long running shounen series. Now I just need to find a place to publish One Piece.


_________________________________x_________________________________


I started working on Kimi ni Todoke the very next day.


“Ikuse-senpai.” My concentration was broken by the voice of Midori Hayakawa, the vice president of the Arts Club of our school.


“Yes?”


“Umm, we have a meeting for the Arts Club.” She said, hesitating slightly.


Ah yeah…


Midori-chan was the Vice President but I… was the President of the Arts Club. These kinds of things were my responsibility.


Why did I take this position again?


Well, I was in my senior year and the rest voted me into the position.


“Okay, let’s go.” I gave her a smile and the girl cheered up instantly.


“Yes. Today we need to discuss what we are going to do for this year’s School Festival. Everyone is very excited.”


And they were indeed very excited. The entire club was abuzz with discussions.


“Taicho!” One of the guys noticed me and stood up. The rest followed.


I had a pretty great reputation in the club. This was due to many reasons.


First was me being at the top of my year. It made many of them look up to me with admiration. Second was due to Tobi, the current ace of the Kendo Club, who had somehow let it out that I was the one who taught him swordsmanship.


Since then, not only the students of the Kendo Club but also the Club Advisor had approached me several times to invite me into the club. They even had arguments with the Arts Club members who thought they were trying to poach their members.


The matter had only calmed down when I publicly denied their invitation and stated that I wanted to become a mangaka.


Last reason was… Sun Seto.


“Is everyone here?”


“Yes, Taicho.”


“Good. Then let’s start the discussions. The school festival is at the end of this month and we need to make a show from the Arts Club. Does anyone have any ideas?”


And the discussions began.


“We can do a puppet show.”


“Eh, who knows how to do that?

“How about we make an arts exhibition?”


“Ughh, we do that every year. Can’t we do something new on top of that?”


“Like what?”


“I don’t know? The Games Club did a Maid Cafe last year and it was very popular.”


“Ehh… no way. I can’t wear something like that. That’s so embarrassing.”


“Ano… how about we…”


“What is it, Midori-chan?”


“Umm… why don’t we do cosplay?”


“Hah? Cosplay?”


“Yes yes. We can totally cosplay anime characters. Many of us want to become artists or mangaka in the future. We can try to make our passions known to others and even promote manga among the students. We can do a presentation on manga as well as how the manga industry is not just some comics for kids but a large and expanding business avenue worth billions of yen.”


The room quieted down.


Manga and manga readers were looked down upon in this day and age. I knew that it would change a lot in the next decade or two but right now, these people face teasing and ridicule from others when they tell their dreams to others.


Perhaps the only reason no one told me anything was that I always aced in my studies. That said, even then, the Principal of the school had once asked me if I really wanted to be a mangaka.


“That’s… do you think it will work?” Someone asked, breaking the silence.


“Who knows… but does that mean we shouldn’t try? It’s not as if we have anything to lose. If we are going to be called otakus and ridiculed either way, then we might as well try.”


Midori-chan was usually so shy but she was extremely passionate about manga.


“Right! What do we have to fear? We can totally pull this off.” I too gave them a few words of encouragement.


This topic… it was close to my heart too.


Everyone looked at me. “Really Taicho?”


“Yeah. Go on, Midori-chan, tell us more about your plan.”


“Yes, Taicho. We can make the presentation from a technical point of view by introducing different types of manga and how manga are made, how much work is put into making even one volume of any manga. We can even make some decorations about different famous mangaka and their achievements. Don’t let anyone look down on how competitive this field is.”


“Hmm, that’s a great idea.”


“Right? Then we can explain about other fields which are related to manga like Anime, Light Novels and games, all of which come together to create a mega giant of an industry which has many opportunities for all. In fact, it would have been even better if we could invite someone from the Manga industry as a guest to explain about the subject. But in case we can't, we can do something related to our favourite manga.” She continued.


She had thought a lot about this.


“What kind of thing?” One of the members asked.


“Well… we can make artwork related to our favourite manga. In fact, I have heard from Tobio Ikuse-kun that it was Taicho who taught him the dance he did last year. He could totally pull a Tanjiro from Demon Slayer…”


“Oi, what the hell is that about me dancing?” I interrupted her in the middle.


This girl was really cutting close to home.


But the fire had already been set.


The entire club exploded.


“Really? That was you?”


“Yeah! That was actually awesome. And now that I think of it, it did kinda look like the Hinokami Kagura.”


“Right! Ikuse-senpai could totally do it better.”


“And we could also collaborate with the Music Club for this performance.”


“I am not dancing. No way.” I waved the topic off.


“But senpai!”


“Taicho, didn’t you say you wanted to be a mangaka? We are promoting manga this time. We can make our entire theme related to Manga. The art can be manga related, the dresses, even the performance can be manga related.”


“All just to make me dance? Are you crazy?”


“It’s for manga, Taicho. We are going to show all those people that Manga is art.”


“Yeah, we will prove that we are not useless otaku.”


Holy crap, just where is the conversation going?


“Taicho!”


“Please Taicho!”


_________________________________x_________________________________


“And just like that, I was surrounded by the entire Arts Club and forced into the whole thing.” I sighed.


“I think you should do it, Nii-san. Remember that you were the one who told me that I can join the dance club too. Why can’t you do the same?” Tobi said, suddenly bringing out something from the past.


“Yes yes. I think Tatsuya-san would look good too.” Sae-chan said. “Don’t you think so, Sun-senpai?”


“Eh… ah, yes.” The girl nodded.


She had started walking home with us since the start of the school year. Her reason was that she didn’t know other people… and it was a decent reason.


Sae-chan and Tobi being the helpful kind they were, welcomed her gladly.


I didn’t have any excuse to deny either. There was no reason I could leave her alone with Sae and Tobi.


“Hmm. Grandma also said that it was a very pretty dance. Please do it, Nii-san. I did it before too.”


“Aghh… alright alright. It’s not like I can back out now. Everyone has already started working on the art already.”


“I can prepare the costume for the dance if you want.” Sae-chan offered.


“No it’s fine, Sae-chan. I have a spare piece. I’ll use that.” The cost of the costume in the System was cheap. “Also, I will be using Yoriichi’s costume instead of Tanjiro’s.”


A good thing that I would be getting a mask to perform.


- Koji Yoshida -


“Really! But wasn’t it going to take six more months?” He asked.


“They have some new kind of technology which they used for this. The project will be ready to air in a month and a half. They have requested us to check it out and see if we want to make any changes since they have extra time on hand. The owner of the company has actually asked for a meeting with you and Kishibe-sensei.”


“A meeting?”


“Hmm. I think they might be trying to get him to serialise Naruto in their studio too. That series is picking up readers everywhere. I suggest that you talk to the owner first and then bring them to visit him. I have already mentioned that he wants to keep his identity a secret. They agreed to it.” 


“Yes, Chief. I will get it done.”


“Good. By the way, how many chapters are left for Kimetsu no Yaiba?”


“Around fifty more.”


“Hmm… a year more then? Alright.”


They talked about a few more details and Koji left the office.


It was big news. Tatsuya would be happy.
