title: Ruling by the Book: Chapter 5: Fallout
content:
Ruling by the Book


Disclaimer: I own nothing


Chapter 5: Fallout


______________________________________________________________________


- Kazuya -


I lay on my bed, surrounded by several people who had come to see me.


“Are you sure it was them? They could be other Shinobi disguised as Mogami and the other servants.” The Stairs Daimyo tried to defend although his sweating made it clear that he was nervous.


“Really? Because I am pretty sure I know of no techniques which could allow even dead bodies to be disguised. Is the dead ninja not one of your envoys?” I asked, narrowing my eyes. The man wisely kept his mouth shut when pointed to the obvious flaw.


The awkward silence was broken by a very calm voice which terrified everyone in the room. “I want answers, Fujimoto.” Grandpa spoke.


I knew he was angry.


No, he was beyond angry at this point.


I had no memory of him being this angry.


But then again, for him, his only family had almost gotten murdered. Of course he will be angry. I will have to explain everything to him when he is alone.


“O-obviously. I will investigate everything and give you a satisfactory answer.”


“Kensho.” He called out.


“Yes, Your Majesty.”


“Put a bounty on the head of all the criminals with the crime of attempted murder and theft. I want their true identities on my desk as soon as possible.” He ordered.


“It will be done, Your Majesty.” He answered seriously. Man, even Kensho was pissed.


They left the room after a while, leaving only Grandpa in the room with me.


He sat on a chair beside me, looking blankly at me.


“I will cancel this engagement.” He said after a while, breaking the silence in the room.


“No. Don’t do that. This marriage is an opportunity which our Land cannot lose.” I interrupted him. Seriously, the reserves of natural gas alone made it something we cannot leave.


“Why are you stopping this now? You weren’t interested in this from the very beginning. What has changed now? Your life is in danger and you still want to pursue this marriage?” He asked, a bit angry.


“I will be fine, Grandpa.” I closed my eyes and sensed for any presences around me and found no one except my own people so I looked at him. “Don’t worry. Everything is under control.”


“You are lying on the bed, a stab wound on your shoulder and you say everything is under control. How is this...being under control!” He shouted.


I stilled for a moment. This was the first time I had seen him shouting. In fact, this was the first time he had ever shouted at me.


“Kuina.”


“Yes.”


“Open the bandages?” I commanded.


“Your Highness?”


“Do it?”


“Kazu-kun, what are you up to?” Grandpa was broken from his anger in a moment and suddenly looked at me worried.


“You said I had secrets of my own, right?” I asked. Seeing him not answering, I just continued. “I am just showing you a few of them to assure you that I will be fine.”


Kuina opened my bandages and I summoned one of the Red Potions.


The appearance of the potion surprised Grandpa but his eyes soon moved to my injuries and got stuck there.


“Grandpa, the ninja who was pretending to be the attendant of Princess Kasumi indeed attacked my warehouse but she was not able to steal anything. I and my subordinates captured everyone...without any injuries.”


“What! But this...”


“Is something I had to do to myself to not let our enemies know about the real situation.” I drank the Red Potion and the wound started to heal in front of his eyes.


His eyes widened as he saw this while I passed the rest of the potion to Kuina for Saitō to heal.


“They were sent by the Medicine Daimyo to steal the secrets of our place and got caught in the trap. The woman did try to attack and kill me but wasn’t able to do so. I am sorry, I didn’t mean to worry you but we had no time to tell you everything as we were running on the clock. I was planning to tell you everything once they left.”


“You!...do you have any idea...” He breathed.


“I am sorry, Grandpa.”


He took a deep breath.


“Kazu-kun, no amount of land or property is more important to me than you. You don’t have to put yourself in danger for the sake of the Land of Stairs.”


“It’s not that simple, Grandpa. The thing which the Land of Stairs has, is something which can make us richer than all of the five big nations combined. It can simply change the fate of our Land. It’s something which I have to try. Moreover, hurting myself was not for that. It was to find a reason to blame the Medicine Daimyo and create a rift between him and his ninja.” I explained my whole plan to him except the summoning part.


“Trust me Grandpa. Just give me a few years and you will see the results of my plans.”


He took a deep breath and I could see several thoughts running through his head.


“Promise me something first.”


“Hmm?”


“Promise me that you will not endanger yourself, that you will not die in all this.”


My eyes softened at his words. “I promise.”


He left the room after this, leaving me with my subordinates alone.


_________________________________x____________________________________


The Stairs entourage left the same day and Grandpa wasn’t kidding.


He destroyed them, even pushing the date for the marriage back till everything was cleared up. He knew I wanted time and gave me just that.


Even the Medicine Daimyo was sent the complaints and Grandpa said that he would have to reconsider their alliance if he couldn’t give us an appropriate answer in regards to the actions of the Kodon Clan.


Till then all trade was suspended between the two Lands. Such a move during a war was a death sentence for the Medicine Daimyo as we were their major food provider.


He will give us an answer soon enough.


As for the Stairs Daimyo, that guy was one step ahead of everyone. He talked to grandpa and left his Granddaughter here as a political hostage to show their sincerity while outwardly claiming that he did so to give us some time to get to know each other.


Seriously, even as someone who hated his guts, I had to praise his move.


He got away with so many things in this one move. One he managed to give Grandpa a good enough reason to not doubt his sincerity and two, he managed to throw the Granddaughter he didn’t want here, eliminating any chance of her knowing anything about his plans.


Even now, the girl herself was staying in the palace, feeling guilty for the whole thing despite having no hand in any of this mess.


I had ordered everyone to treat her with respect and show her no hostility. The least I could do was give her a chance at a normal life here.


A week had passed and I was finally released from medical care officially.


During this time, the princess had visited me several times. In fact, she used to come here everyday, bring flowers, sometimes cut fruits for me, small things like these.


The very first day, I checked the information about her in the book to see what she was planning but it turns out that she was actually blaming herself for everything and was trying to make it up to me so that we don’t start a war with the Land of Stairs due to this whole mess.


Now I felt bad for the girl.


At least here she was making some friends in Kanae.


Seraphim on the other hand, was difficult.


The girl was extremely rude, although she followed her orders and was extremely competent too so there was not much we could do.


She at least explained why because her clan was at war for over a hundred years at that point and they were always thrown into wars, which made her the way she is.


Vampire Ninjas apparently used magic for their ninja techniques. The downsides of this was that she would need to drink blood if she used up her magic in a fight.


Currently, Kanae was teaching her how to use Chakra and she was picking it up very quickly. We also observed that using chakra didn’t weaken her.


She was a solid Chunin level ninja.


My old subordinates were progressing quickly too.


Saitō showed why he was one of the strongest in his world. After recovering from his injuries, he went ahead and opened the Third Gate.


Kanae was able to open the Second Gate as well but it left her exhausted.


I was able to learn Water Breathing, although only the basics. As for the Gates, my stronger physique allowed me to open one and I felt like I could open the second one too but I didn’t want to push and mess things up.


My main focus was on Fuinjutsu for now.


The actual MVP was actually Kuina, who could also open the Third Gate and was even progressing in her Water Breathing at an incredible pace.


Her One Piece World Physique was really showing its power. Her swordsmanship when using Gates was insane.


Too bad none of the swords we had could bear it.


I was planning to search for the Kusanagi Blade for her or try summoning something good for her when I could.


All of them were strong, well in the Chunin level in their base form and even reaching Tokubetsu Jōnin while using Gates.


Unfortunately, the opponent we were up against was something even Jōnin level ninjas wouldn’t casually face.


And that’s why I had to prepare.


Today was the day I was planning to do the next ritual.


In the last week, Saitō had been extracting information from the ninjas who had attacked me.


We only got some basic information. The Jōnin didn’t say anything at all.


The rituals were getting far more complicated than before.


For example, this ritual needed an entire day to complete. It could only be done on the night of a full moon.


This made me wonder what would have happened if someone wanted to do this ritual before Kaguya was sealed?


Gotta thank the Sage of Six Paths and his younger brother for this.


The sacrifice of seven chunin level ninjas to open a portal to summon the Shinigami and get its power to strengthen my soul.


While the Uzumaki had only been able to summon the Shinigami with the sacrifice of the user, if one wanted to summon it with the sacrifice of others, the number of sacrifices increased. Moreover, each of them needed to be at least at a minimum level of strength, that’s why chunin.


I placed a hand on my Grimoire and began the ritual and all of a sudden, the entire area cooled down.


I could even see my breath becoming misty.


I concentrated and sure enough, a figure manifested in front of me.


It was a translucent, gaunt spectre with a demonic visage, much larger than an average human, possessing long, shaggy, white hair, from which two red horns protrude, as well as purple-hued skin. It was draped in a large white kimono and carried a set of prayer beads. It had a tanto in its mouth.


Just looking at it gave me a pressure on my soul like never before.


It removed the tanto which revealed its mouth which was full of jagged teeth and a long purple tongue. Then before I could react, it unsheathed its sword and twirled around in a dance-like move, reaping the souls of all seven ninja in one single attack and devouring them all.


Then it turned towards me, staring at me with its dark bottomless eyes and suddenly stabbed me in the chest with its sword.


I felt the world go white all of a sudden and lost consciousness.


The next morning, my eyes opened due to the sunlight greeting my face.


Opening my eyes, I looked around and found myself laying in the courtyard of the warehouse. I had warned my people to not come in until I called them personally as I had no idea what the Shinigami could do.


Around me were the bodies of the seven chunin whom I quickly stored in my Grimoire before I began cleaning everything.


I had kept everyone waiting outside and didn’t want them to wait any longer.


While doing this, I checked my own body and found out that my chakra had increased by at least four times at the very least.


Soul strengthening’s effects were not directly visible but showed when my body increased in strength.


It also gave one an affinity with Yin Chakra, Genjutsu as well as made one resistant to genjutsu. A very less known fact was that someone with a stronger soul could control their chakra far better.


With this ritual, I was pretty sure that my soul was far stronger than the souls of most of the shinobi who have ever walked this world. There were more rituals for the soul but I couldn’t do them any time soon.


They required the souls of demons to be sacrificed permanently for the next stage. The only place which even had the rumours of demons was in the Land of Demons but I had no clue about it so there was no way I could get anywhere with it.


But that didn’t mean I could progress anywhere. In fact, now that the soul rituals were done for the time being, I could begin with the body and mind.


That said, my chakra reserves were comparable to that of the Jōnin we had captured and would only grow more in the future.


In fact, there were even rituals to increase chakra reserves and the first ritual for that was quite easy as well.


I had already collected all the materials for it and just needed to wait till my body adapts to my current chakra level.


At this rate, I was sure that I could get to Elite Jōnin level of chakra in the next few months, before we go for Rōen.


That kind of strength with the Eight Inner Gates could give me some confidence to keep my people safe from at least the smaller nations.


One step at a time and one day, not even the big five will be able to push us around.


When I walked out, I was greeted by the worried faces of my subordinates.


“Did you faint again?” Kuina asked, looking slightly worried.


“Yes. This ritual was a lot harder than the last one. Took too much out of me.” I let out a sigh remembering the Shinigami.


This world...it was really far more than what was shown in the anime or manga. Then again, disclosing all the secrets of the whole world in just one story is absolutely impossible.


“I told you, he would be fine. Bugs have an incredible capacity to survive.” My thoughts were broken by the sudden comment and I looked at the speaker with a deadpan.


Seraphim...


This girl was...sigh...


“What? That’s a compliment.”


I still had no idea how to deal with her.


So I just smiled. “Why thank you, Sera.”


I saw her eyes twitch at the nickname while Kanae just giggled at the situation. Kuina and Saitō rolled their eyes.


Two can play at this game.


- Rina Uzumaki -


“And that’s all for the reports, my lord.” She bowed. Her sister was already on one of her knees, waiting for their next command. In front of her was the Uzukage, Shiroyasha-sama and beside her sat her husband, the Daimyo of the Land of Whirlpools, Hiroki-sama and between them sat their daughter...Princess Tamami Uzumaki.


The Land of the Whirlpools was unique in the way that both the Kage and the Daimyo were from the same family.


This helped them keep a focused decision making body at their head and keep their clan out of unnecessary wars unlike the other countries who were forced to go to war by their Daimyo.


In those countries, the Daimyo always tries to keep the powers of the Kage restrained which is not the case with Uzushiogakure and the Land of Whirlpools.


“Iwa, Kumo and Mizu working together behind the scenes is indeed big news if it is true. Recently, the war has been in a very...unnatural state. The three sides are pushing Konoha but they are not using their full power anywhere. It seemed that they were trying to play a game of attrition with them, which is a decent strategy when it is one against three, forcing Konoha to give up and make a settlement in a long term war, maybe gain some of their territory or just monetary gains but at no point have they shown any hints of an actual alliance. If that’s the case then they must be plotting something big.”


“Did the prince of the Land of Flowers tell you himself?”


“Yes, Uzukage-sama.”


“Did he tell you anything else?”


“He asked us not to reveal that it was him who disclosed the news and gave us a scroll.”


Mina handed over the scroll to the Uzukage.


She opened the scroll and read the contents, her eyebrows raising at one point.


“What is it, dear?” Daimyo-sama asked.


“A job commission, two actually.” She answered before looking at them. “What kind of person is this Prince of the Land of Flowers? What can you tell me about the Land of Flowers right now?”


“The Prince, Kazuya-sama is a very dedicated and honest person. He single handedly developed a new method of agriculture which can increase the production of crops in the Land of Flowers by 50%. And he didn’t just keep it to himself but actually distributed the method among his people. Due to this the people of the Land of Flowers are still in a relatively good state even during this war.” She reported.


“He is also training hundred or so children to raise them as samurai to establish a police force which he intends to expand throughout his country to improve the security of his people. In fact, he himself trains with them. The people of his land love him a lot.”


“An agricultural method to increase production by 50%?” Daimyo raised an eyebrow. “And he distributed it to everyone? Isn’t he afraid of the method being stolen by others?”


The answer to his question came not from them but rather his own daughter. “That guy just doesn’t care. I had asked him about this too and he said that if the method is spread in other countries, they would grow more food and would at least stop bothering them for food. So he actually wanted everyone to actually find out. His actual goal is to improve the lives of his people. Having plenty of food will make everyone’s lives better. That guy is really dumb at times, ya know?”


“Oh! You seem to know him quite well?” Daimyo asked.


“Hmm, I do. Can you believe it, that guy actually learned basic Fuinjutsu by himself and was even teaching it to the kids training to be Samurai? It was so basic that anyone could have walked through those seals in minutes.”


“Yes. He did write about it. He even thanked you saying that you were an extremely great teacher.” Uzukage-sama said with a smile at her daughter.


“I just taught him the basics about Fuinjutsu. He had only memorised some seals but knew nothing of the art itself. The guy was dumb, I tell you. He was older than me and still at the basic level. Even children in Uzushio are better at Fuinjutsu than him.” The Princess just huffed.


“Oh, and yet this so-called dumb person identified your disguise and you didn’t find out?” The Uzukage joked, making her go red.


“I apologise, Uzukage-sama.” She quickly apologised. It was after all due to their failure that put them in such a position.


“You don’t have to apologise, Rina. You people already did a great job bringing her out here alive. This is more than I can ask knowing the danger you encountered in the mission. By the way, what do you know about this prince’s fuinjutsu skill?


“I investigated and found out that the Prince had only started learning about chakra slightly over a year ago. If that’s the case then he is extremely talented in Fuinjutsu, reaching Intermediate level in just a year mostly without any guidance except the one week under Lady Tamami.”


“He reached intermediate level, did he? I guess he really liked Tamami’s teachings that’s why he has given us a contract for large scale warding and security seals for the Land of Flowers. Moreover, he has requested for a teacher to guide him with Fuinjutsu. He is willing to pay equivalent to an S Class Mission every month for the guidance. The second request is obviously left to our discretion but he promises his friendship if we agree to it.” Uzukage said making them freeze.


“The request for the warding of properties is not bad but teaching Fuinjutsu, even if we only teach them basic knowledge, is a big deal. It is similar to establishing an alliance between the two countries and especially with a place like the Land of Flowers which doesn’t even have a ninja village. Moreover, can he really represent his country in proposing the alliance?” She asked.


“This...the Prince is the only descendant of the current daimyo and the previous daimyo. With his popularity, it is all but decided that he will be the next daimyo.” She replied.


“What do you think we should do, dear?” The Uzukage asked Daimyo-sama.


“Hmm. How about accepting the request for warding and observing them first? If things are good, we can talk with them about establishing an alliance. Maybe send a girl from the clan as a concubine to the Prince, further strengthening the alliance. After that, teaching him to an Advanced level or even Expert level would not be a loss. If the guy is really as good as they say, he will reach there by himself in the future. So doing this will only serve to help build more trust.” Daimyo-sama replied after a moment of thought.


“Very well. We will send a team there to complete the request made by the Prince. You two will be the ones leading the team. You also need to investigate the Prince and his political inclinations for the alliance.”


“Yes, Uzukage-sama.”


As they were talking, there was suddenly a knock on the door.


“Enter.”


A Jōnin entered looking worried.


“What is the matter? Why do you look so worried?”


“Uzukage-sama. We have just received urgent news...”


- Stairs Daimyo -


“How dare that bastard! He wants me to give him an answer?” He watched as the Medicine Daimyo, Wakui Yoshiki, threw the glass in his hand, smashing it on the wall and the pieces shattering all over the place.


The man then looked at him. “How did it come to this? You said they didn’t have anyone who could fight a Jōnin.”


“They don't. Apart from the three Samurai there were no other strong guards. This is something verified by the shinobi you sent too. They are the ones who messed up the mission and even failed to hide their identities. All this has put the entire plan in jeopardy.” He sighed.


“Is he doubting you?” Wakui asked.


“Obviously he would doubt me. I took those shinobi as my own people. I was able to calm that bastard with great efforts, even leaving that girl there as a supposed political hostage to assure him that I wasn’t planning anything bad. What kind of incompetent shinobi did you send? They couldn’t even knock him out.” He complained. “And now you say they ran away with all the information.”


He didn’t regret leaving that girl there.


If anything, it assured that she would not find anything about the plan. She was just an expendable...the daughter of a dead concubine of his son. Unfortunately, both of them died in an ambush during a trip to the Land of Vegetables, leaving her alone.


Well, he was glad he didn’t send her away to her mother’s family who were just a bunch of businessmen who traded weapons made in the Land of Stairs with other Lands. At least now she could be of some use.


“Those were the best of the Howling Wolf Village’s shinobi or so they said. I even paid them a hefty sum of money. They must have run away and defected to sell the information to other people for a greater sum. Those damn traitors. I gave them shelter when they needed it and now they are betraying me. Truly, these shinobi can never be trusted. I will put a reward on their heads and see them brought to me on their knees.”


“What should we do with the demands of Katsuyoshi? He wants strict actions against the Kodon Clan and an explanation from us or he will put the alliance on hold. We cannot lose this alliance or all our plans will go to waste.”


“Oh he won’t back down. I don’t need to give them any explanation. All we need to do is send some people and burn the crops in his country. Just because the brat has developed some new things and is growing more crops, they think they can dictate terms to us? Let them lose their crops for a year and suffer a bit to learn a lesson.”


“Would that be a good idea? What if Kumo or Iwa intervenes? They depend on them for food.” He tried to dissuade the guy.


“Hmph, those barbarians are busy in their own war. They can’t even take down one Konoha, let alone have time to think about a small country like the Land of Flowers.” The guy snorted.


Suddenly, there was a knock on the door.


“Father! Something big has happened.” Came the voice of his son-in-law and the Prince of the land of Medicine.


“Come in.”


The door opened as the boy bowed towards them.


“What’s the matter? Why are you so worried?” Wakui asked.


“Father. The Land of Sky, Konoha has destroyed the Land of Sky and its hidden village.” He said, making them freeze.


“What?!”


The Land of Sky was a country which was far more advanced technologically than any other country. Their shinobi could even fly with the machines they had created.


Such a country...how could they?


“Why? And how did this happen?” He asked.


“The reason given was that they had challenged the sovereignty of the Five Great Ninja Villages and were destroyed for that reason. Neither of the four other villages or even the Daimyo of those Lands spoke anything about this indicating that it was done by their agreement. Father, what should we do? Would they?”


The boy was sweating and so were they. An entire village was just razed to the ground...just the words chilled their hearts.


Challenging the sovereignty...in simple words, they were becoming too strong for the liking of the bigger villages.


He looked at Wakui and spoke. “We cannot take any action against the Land of Flowers. If Kumo or Iwa caught even a hint of our involvement, we would be ruined.”


Wakui also seemed to have broken from his trance and nodded.


“This was a warning...from the big five to the smaller countries.”


“Yes. We...we should probably reduce the number of ninjas to show that we don’t mean to challenge them. Didn’t Katsuyoshi want answers? Tell him the members of the Kodon Clan will be exiled from the Land of Medicine. That should give him an answer and even satisfy the big five villages?”


“Are you really going to exile them?” He asked surprised.


“Obviously not. I will at best relocate them. In fact, you should keep them in the Land of Stairs, away from the heat as civilians. It would also teach them a lesson for betraying me.” Wakui said, wiping his sweat as his mind worked quickly. “And this will set an example for the rest of the Clans in the Howling Wolf Village to remain within their limits. Yes, this is a good plan.” Wakui nodded to himself.


“Hmm, yes. That should keep Katsuyoshi satisfied.” He agreed. Maybe he could even sway those Kodon Ninja to his side and establish a Ninja village in the Land of Stairs? That way, he will have more cards in the future. He thought to himself.


They discussed the plan for the rest of the night.


A country was destroyed.


The coming days were sure to be full of chaos.


- Kazuya -


The destruction of the Land of Sky hit hard even when I knew what was coming.


Challenging the sovereignty of the five Great Ninja Villages...


The reason alone made me clench my fist in anger. So those bastards could do whatever they want, rampage in other people’s lands but no one else was allowed to do so?


No.


There was no use in getting angry.


It was better to use this as motivation and become stronger. Only by becoming stronger can I break through this endless loop.


“What do you think our next action should be, Kazu-kun?” Grandpa asked as he drank his tea.


“We proceed as we were. They will only take action against us when they see us as a threat. Right now, we are nothing like that.” I replied.


“Good, then so be it.” He nodded.


Ever since that day in the hospital room, he had left all these decisions on me entirely.


“Did you get any reply from the Medicine and Stairs?” I asked.


“No, but I expect a positive reply soon enough. They wouldn’t dare take any actions after the Land of the Sky incident.”


“I can only hope so. By the way, how is your health? Are those medicines working?”


A smile came to his face soon. “Yes. They are working far better than I had expected. Dare I say we can get a great market for them if we sell them.”


“No. We are not going to even reveal them let alone sell them. Those medicines are very essential for our samurai.” I denied.


“Well, your decision then.”


“Don’t worry, Grandpa. I have some plans for establishing industries in our country.” I reassured him.


“As I said, it’s your decision. You probably don’t realise your popularity in the people. When the news about the attack on you came out, the Stairs Daimyo’s procession received glares from people on their way back till they were completely out of the country. I am afraid if our people were not escorting them, they could have been attacked on their way back. Even some of the notoriously cowardly nobles wanted the Stairs guy to be detained until this matter was solved.” He said with a smile, making me sweatdrop. “At this rate, even if I were to make you a Daimyo today, no one would raise a question. They would even welcome it.”


“I am not yet ready for the responsibilities, Grandpa. I...my efforts are needed in research right now. I think I can contribute more to our people that way.” I shook my head.


Right now, I am using every moment of my time to train or research. I didn’t have any time to concentrate on governance of the country.


“Then take your time and do what you want.” He nodded. “All I want is a great grandchild.”


Ah...there he goes again.


“By the way, the princess of Stairs is quite a great girl herself. I seriously think she would make for a great wife for you.”


“Grandpa!”


“What? Don’t tell me you don’t think she is pretty?”


“That’s not the issue.” I protested. On the side note, Kasumi was pretty.


“Then what is? Aside from her scheming family, she has no flaws at all. I don’t get you sometimes. Other princes your age all have several lovers. Even the ones who had no chance to inherit the throne are the same. And yet, here you are, not showing any interest in other girls. No, that’s not true.You do have three beautiful girls in your subordinates but I never hear any news about you going anywhere with them. I am getting old, you know. I really want to see the face of my great grandchildren before I die.”


...


...


...


...


I merely deadpanned at him.


“I am not ready to be a father right now, Grandpa. Give me some time. You will have your great grandchildren.”


“Well, as long as that happens, I have no problem.”


...


“By the way, I saw the information given to us by the Stairs Daimyo about the Princess. It is said that she is the daughter of the fourteenth concubine of the Stairs’ Daimyo’s son who died along with him in the ambush but I know for sure that Princess Kasumi’s mother was not his concubine.”


This was something which had struck me when I was reading everything.


“Really?” He asked, confused.


“I am pretty sure she wasn’t a concubine.”


“Must be another lie that bastard made up then. Well, what does it matter who her mother was? In fact, it’s good if she is not related to that bastard’s family. The girl is good. You should spend more time with her. I have seen how she takes care of you and I have no problems with her either.”


“Alright, don’t go in that direction.” I stopped him from going off into his great grandchildren drama again.


“Okay okay, sheesh. Can’t an old man state his wish nowadays?”


And thus continued our banter.

_________________________________x____________________________________


Today was the day that the information about Rōen was completely gathered.


I looked at all the information and got to know what Rōen is and how strong it is.


Apparently, it wasn’t some kind of Tailed Beast like being. It wasn’t a chakra construct either. It was just a mutated monster which could absorb the chakra of other beings and live almost eternally.


It was as strong as a tailed beast, but only One Tails. That would explain the five months time needed to extract the information about it.


That means, I cannot use it repeatedly like I had wanted to like a tailed beast.


Dammit, that changes many things.


I will have to come up with another method.


Still, it was not something I could let go.


Even without that, it could still serve as a sacrifice for a ritual to use in a summoning and that kind of power could be used to summon someone strong.


It might just be the deterrent we need to keep away people with bad thoughts. It also reduced the difficulty of the whole mission as I just had to sacrifice the wolf instead of seal it inside me. That’s something far easier to do. I just needed some practice for something like that.


Maybe this time I will use that Jōnin as a sacrifice to summon someone stronger?


Until now, I had been saving stronger shinobi prisoners for the previous soul ritual. Now, I had no such needs.


Still, with Rōen being a failure, I will have to find other targets for my experiment.


Another very important thing which had happened recently was the Grimoire getting charged for World Travel.


It had enough energy to send me to another world and bring me back once. I could have gathered this energy far faster if I had been using my own energy but I have been using my own energy for training and summoning everyday. I barely had any extra energy to spare for this.


I still couldn’t control the world I was travelling to but each world gets recorded in the Grimoire and a return trip to that world would only take half the energy next time.


I had to make some preparations before doing so, like preparing enough funds if I wanted to buy something, all in Gold and precious jewels, mastering basic genjutsu to avoid problems. I already knew the transformation technique but some genjutsu will always be more helpful.


__________________________________x___________________________________


I stood in front of Kuina, facing her once more.


“Start!” At Kanae’s instructions, we both shot from our places, clashing in between, sending shockwaves around us.


I felt the weight of her attack and twisted my sword, letting her attack slip by as I took a step forward, intending to strike her with my next move.


She was however one step ahead and quickly rotated her body in a dance-like motion, getting behind me.


I quickly dove forward, dodging her attack before kicking the ground and using the force to turn around and attack.


She faced me head on, clashing with me.


“Don’t forget to breathe, Kazuya-san. Breathe!” Kanae shouted from the side and I realised that my breath had faltered and picked it up again.


Total Concentration Breathing was hard, especially during fights.


Kuina however was not giving up her attacks and continued pursuing me.


The clashes got faster and we separated before suddenly releasing the first gate at the same time and rushing at each other again.


Our clashes continued before I felt my boost from the opened gate fading away and used all my strength to attack. She replied in kind, the resulting clash shattering the swords...again.


“Dammit! This is the fifteenth sword.” She complained looking at the shattered sword in her hand.


Yeah.


This was becoming a problem for us.


“Chakra blades are stronger but getting them is not easy. I have already told Kensho to get us some but it will take some time. I will try to find the location of the Kusanagi Blades. It’s just that those blades are very famous and might attract the eyes of some unscrupulous ninja.”


“You need to man up a bit. We need to stop being so afraid.” She huffed but didn’t pressure me anymore.


I sighed.


RIght now, I was using all my summoning attempts to summon precious metals and jewels for trade in other worlds after world travel.


I could understand her frustrations though.


The lack of good swords was holding her back. In fact, even in this fight, I was going full strength without any weights while she was wearing her weights even now.


Not to mention, I had told her about the kind of people she would have to face in her world and how strong Zoro becomes and thus she didn’t want to get left behind.


Kuina was very competitive.


“I will get something to solve this problem.” I promised.


She nodded and then left for training.


I sat there, regaining my breath. Even with my physique, opening the gate and fighting was hard.


Kanae handed me a towel and sat beside me.


“You shouldn’t blame yourself, you know. We all know how hard you work but there is only so much one can do by themselves. In fact, Kuina is also feeling frustrated because she is not being able to help you out.”


“Hmm?”


“You two are friends, aren’t you?” She asked.


I nodded.


“And that’s why when she sees you working so hard and cannot do anything, she feels frustrated. Unlike you however, the only thing she can do well is swordsmanship but now even that is being hindered. It makes her feel useless.”


“But that’s not true. She is already the strongest one among us.”


“That she is...but she is not strong enough to protect everyone. Kuina is a very good girl. She wants to share your burdens with you. We all do...even Seraphim.”


“Sera? Hahahaha, yeah, she would sooner use me for her Tsubame Gaeshi training.” I laughed out loud.


“That’s not true, you know. In fact, did you know that vampire ninjas have a strange custom?” She asked, smiling mysteriously.


“What custom?” I asked, taking a bottle from my side and taking a sip of the water.


“If they kiss someone, they are considered married to them.”


I spat out the water immediately and looked at Kanae who was still smiling calmly.


“You are kidding right?” I asked, stunned. There was no way...


“No. I was told this by Sera-chan herself.”


“But that was an accident. You all saw it yourself.” I protested.


“Yes. But Sera-chan is very serious about it.”


“No way. She is the type to kill me and then kill herself rather than accept something like that.” I retorted.


“Sigh, you don’t know how a woman’s heart works, Kazuya-san.”


“That woman tried to kill me the first time she saw me, ya know. I am saying this from experience.”


“And your experience with women is...not very good, is it?”


...


Low blow, Kanae. Low blow.


This was something I would expect from Kuina, not you.


As the days passed, we were growing closer to each other.


Kuina, Saitō, Kanae and now even Sera, they have become my close friends.


I told them what I knew about their worlds, except Seraphim, whose world I knew almost nothing about.


The most I could remember from that world was the existence of a chainsaw wielding magical girl and sometimes a guy wearing the same magical girl costume...


I was pretty sure she would look at me like I was some kind of a pond scum if I told her this...that’s why we didn’t have much to share between us.


Still, we were getting closer. And now, I find this.


That night we gathered for another ritual. This time, the Kodon Jōnin was brought with us.


Preparing a ritual to assist with the summoning was a lot more complicated.


It took me several hours to get the ritual circle ready.


Finally, when everything was done, I threw the woman in the circle and stood outside it, summoning my Grimoire.


“Let’s hope this works.” I said to myself.


I want someone strong to help us with the Rōen mission.


And then I felt a drain in chakra.


Even my Jōnin level chakra went dry almost instantly and I fell to my knees, biting my tongue to not lose my consciousness.


A strange scene took place in front of us.


The body of the ninja in the ritual circle was compressed, turning into a ball of flesh and blood. It started spinning in the ritual circle, releasing a red light before slowly taking the form of a person. Slowly, the ball turned into the form of a man.


He was a tall, muscular man with mid-length straight black hair that reached to his ears. His eyes were green, and he had thin black eyebrows and a scar on the corner of his right lip.


When the process was completed, the man just looked at himself and muttered. “Huh, so that was not fake. I thought I was hallucinating due to blood loss.” He then looked at us and asked. “So, you all seem to be the people who summoned me for some help. What do you need?”


I stepped forward. “Hello. My name is Kazuya Katsuyoshi. I summoned you to help us to help protect my country. May I know what to call you?” I asked.


“Protect your country? What happened, did Japan go to war again? I thought those days were left behind.”


“Umm, this is not Japan. You are in a different world.”


“...seriously?”


“Yes. I made sure you would know it when being summoned. Did you not hear?”


“...I was kinda bleeding out, being stared at by that white haired demon when I heard the voice. I accepted before I could hear anything else.”


...


“That’s...I am sorry I guess.”


“Don’t be. If I wasn’t here, I would be dead. Being alive feels better. So, a new world eh. That’s certainly something I haven’t heard of before. Oh, name’s Toji by the way. Toji Fushiguro.”


...fuck.


_________________________________x____________________________________


I looked at the guy who was devouring enough food for fifteen people with no care in the world.


This didn’t look like someone who was on the verge of dying and was summoned to a new world.


The first thing he did was ask for food and I provided him that.


While this was happening, I thought about this summoning.


Toji said he was dying so it must have been a fight with Gojo but there were no injuries on his body.


Did the sacrifice neutralise it?


Moreover, Toji would be equal to a taijutsu specialist jōnin or even elite level in terms of his physique but he still needs training in other aspects of chakra.


I am sure that he would be a force to be reckoned with when he learns the Eight Inner Gates technique.


In fact, the Eight Inner Gates fit him too well and even without that, just having chakra alone would make him far stronger. Maybe I could get my first Kage level fighter out of him if things go well.


The guy finished eating and looked at me. “So, now tell me what I need to do.”


...


“What? Why are you looking confused? Despite what you might think, I cannot read minds, you know.”


“No, no. I know that. I was just a bit surprised that you agreed so easily.”


“Well, I was dying and now I am here, suddenly healed and alive. I accepted the deal. I have lived enough to know these things don’t come for free. So, what do I need to do?” He answered with a shrug.


“I...”


I explained the whole situation to him


“That’s interesting. So, how strong would you say I am compared to these...ninjas?”


“A jōnin in terms of physique but you would die in a fight against one.”


He raised an eyebrow, unconvinced. “Really?”


I nodded. “I know quite a lot about you and your world, both past and the future.”


“Hoh, and what does the future hold?”


“Are you sure you want to know?” I asked.


“I have nothing to lose, so why not?”


“Very well, since you chose it, I will not hide.”


I went on to explain to him the future events of Jujutsu Kaisen and almost an hour later, the guy’s face was a sight to behold.


“Send me back, now.” He said in a no nonsense voice.


“I can’t.”


“Why?!”


“I am not strong enough. I could probably open a portal to your world but I am just not strong enough right now. Moreover, what can you even do if you go back? As you are now, Gojo would kill you either way.”


“I can take him on.”


“No, no you can’t. Not anymore. You had your chance and you lost it. Satoru Gojo is now forever beyond your reach.”


I saw him clench his fists and glare at me.


“I will send you back when I can and even help you out to the best of my abilities, this is a promise. But until then, you need to help me too. In fact, use this chance and become stronger. You can learn things here that will make you nigh invincible in your own world.” I convinced the guy over the whole night before he finally calmed down.


By the end of it, we had an agreement between us.


I will help him get stronger and send him back to his world, or at least summon his son and step-daughter here in case something happens to him and in return, he will help me to the best of his abilities.


When I asked him if he was fine with it, his reply was.


“I am used to being hired for this kind of work. This time I just have to work for something other than money. Something far more important.”


And so, I had Toji Fushiguro join the team.

title: Ruling by the Book: Chapter 4: Engagement

Ruling by the Book

Chapter 4: Engagement


______________________________________________________________________


- Kazuya -


“Have they settled?” I asked, taking a seat.


“Yes. They lost their consciousness. The youngest one was barely able to stand either. We arranged doctors for them but at the rate they are healing, it will take over a month for them to recover. It looks like the Iwa shinobi were trying to catch them alive for some reason so the poison they used was mostly for the purpose of subduing and not killing them.”Saitō explained.


“Yes, the Uzumaki have always had exceptional life force. They can heal pretty fast.”


“They have something big to hide. You have noticed that the person dressed up as a guy is actually a girl. She must be someone very important.”


Crossdressing?


Damn, I did not notice that at all.


“Did you find anything about the Iwa Shinobi?”


“Two among the dead were Jōnin ranked and the rest were Chunin. Those two redheads must be exceptionally strong to take on that kind of force, probably Elite Jōnin at the very least. We are interrogating them but they are not speaking.”


“Such people rarely talk. Just do not let them die. I will take care of them. Have you cleared out the area of the fight?” I asked.


“Yes. Everything has been cleared out and all traces of battle have been removed. I have ordered the students to plant flowers on the land, to cover the area too.”


“Good. Keep a watch on our guests and see that they are hidden from the view of normal people. No one must know they are here.”


“Yes.” Saitō nodded.


I saw a hint of hesitation in his eyes.


“Any questions?”

“Oh Ikki-kun is a wonderful student. A very hard worker. His training is going extremely well. You know what? Why don’t you guys come over and visit every now and then? Give me an opportunity to play host sometimes.”


“Sure. I will impose upon you then.”


“Hahahaha you won’t be imposing on anyone. Always feel welcome. By the way, how is your magic training going? I heard that you guys went off on a training trip. How was it?” He asked.


There weren’t that many people in the Restaurant right now so I sat down in front of him and we talked.


I told him about the training trip, the war and all that happened later.


Everyone has been busy with their own work since then.


The girls were teaching the Kijin before bringing them to my world. Normally they would have their magic lessons with August but he had gone somewhere with Zeref and Irene so we had some time off to ourselves.


Tanya was making preparations for establishing our new Publishing House.


I didn’t want to put my name out for now so it was the girls who were going to be listed as the owners of the company. In fact, Lavy was not using her name either as she was quite well known in some magician circles and they could come look for her here.


Finally it was decided that Shuna would be listed as the owner as Sakura was still not of age yet and she was the princess of the Kijin who would be staying here so it made more sense for her to be the owner.


Yuri and Narberal would be partners in the company.


I was busy with my Restaurant.


Rimuru on the other hand had been busy. The different races in the Jura forest were wary of his village now that he had all those orcs and ogres or rather Kijin under him. The village was attacked by a bunch of Lizardmen but they were beaten up before they could even get closer to the village.


The Hobgoblin Riders had gone to the other Goblin villages and gathered them all under one wing and all of them agreed after they found out that the Kijin had joined, even the ones who had rejected previously.


They formed a pact with the guardians of the Jura Forest, the dryads under someone called Treyni to protect the forest from outside invasion because now Veldora was absent in return for being recognised by the Dryads.


Rimuru had then sent a few Kijins to the Lizardman territory to send a message to the Lizardman chief about the attack on Tempest and found out that they were doing so on their own initiative.


The idiots who had attacked were led by the son of the chief who actually tried to rebel against his father to attack the Kijin but was beaten to an inch of his life by them. He was later banished along with a hundred of his followers and they ended up joining Tempest.


Really, fate's ways are strange.


Ainz on the other hand had decided to take a break from levelling and explore his own world. He encountered some attackers who were attacking the nearby village from a different country. He took them out and brought the village under his protection and went to investigate the situation in the nearby city.


After Kisuke-san left, I went back to the kitchen as Bang-san had come in immediately afterwards and ordered.


"Mr. Bang's order for a hotpot is done." I called out as I placed the fish on the counter where Shuna carried it from.


Issac-san was waiting there too. He wanted to discuss the business deal for Nitro Rice with me.


We had found a middle path for our trade.


It turns out that while I couldn’t sell raw ingredients, I could use those ingredients as dressing or make dishes which used those ingredients in raw form and sell them that way.


This money could help us with relocating the Kijin to this town and also establish the Publishing House.


“Silas, come, I was just waiting for you.” Issac-san called me. Tanya was already sitting in front of him.


I had no experience in these things and had put Tanya to it.


She had gone to his world with Tohru and had returned a day later after collecting some information she needed.


“I apologise for making you wait.” I said while taking a seat.


“No worries. I am the one who should apologise for interrupting your work. Anyways, our Hunters Association has agreed to go on with the trade. Will will buy a set amount of Nitro Rice as well as the Herb of All-Illness each month.”


I watched as Tanya discussed the price for the item and by gods, she was savage when it came to business.


She haggled and brought the price from nine hundred to twelve hundred times the original price, at which I got those things from the System.


Not twelve or one hundred and twenty… twelve hundred times.


According to her, that was the current price of those items in his world. It was something she had found out from her bare basics understanding of that world and the fact that there was extremely high demand but no supply for that product, allowing her to jack up the prices however she wanted.


We all agreed to the price and Issac-san agreed to pick up the goods the next day and transfer the money at the same time.


My mind was still buzzing at the amount of money we had just made with this one deal.


Even Tanya looked proud. “This is the biggest deal I have closed in both my lives.” She smiled proudly. “I am getting my cut for this, right?”


“5% as agreed.” I nodded. “Still, this much will be enough to get us enough property in this town to settle the Kijin and even set up the Publishing House and get the equipment required. We might even have some extra left over.”


“Easily.” Tanya nodded. “We would even have enough left over to open some other businesses too. I was thinking about expanding into collectibles and figurines. We could try introducing a manga based on Card Games and use it to market cards using gacha. Those things sell for a lot of money.”


... 


Some of her plans made me shiver, despite my resistance to the cold.


This girl is evil.


But then again, this same girl just made me a billionaire.


I sometimes wondered how the System managed the currency exchange thing between worlds without crashing the economies of entire countries… then I realise that I am thinking about a System which can open gates to different worlds, completely different universes. Compared to that, what’s a few billions?


The System never answers any questions but it still does so many things behind the scenes that I have no idea about.


Suddenly, the door to the shop opened and in came Rimuru who was looking tired. He was followed by Benimaru and Hakurou and another young girl with pink coloured twin tails.


"Ohh, what place is this? And what is that scent?" The girl jumped around looking at everything curiously before jumping to Bang's seat and staring at his Hotpot.


"Behave Milim." Rimuru dragged her back to a different place while the girl stared and almost drooled at the hotpot. "I'm sorry, Bang-san."


"Hahaha no worries. It's good for young ones to be energetic." the old man waved it off.


"She is more than two thousand years old though."


This caused the man to almost choke on his food as he stared at the cute girl with shock in his eyes.


"Silas, get a full course of the best you can get. Actually, get us a serving of the rabbit dish you gave us that day and then start cooking the main course." Rimuru ordered while Benimaru came and said something in Shuna's ears, making her stiff.


I looked at him questioningly but he just pointed at Shuna before going back to take a seat behind Rimuru while Hakurou took a seat with Mr. Bang. He was already a part of the old monsters group.


Shuna came and relayed the information to me.


The girl was called Milim Nava, one of the oldest and strongest Demon Lords from Rimuru's world who had come to Tempest.


Rimuru enticed her with food and brought her here to soothe her because the top brass had picked a fight with her thinking that she was there to kill Rimuru.


...  damn, talk about fucking up.


Still, this is a Demon Lord?


"Ohh, are you a daemon? You can cook?" I looked back to see her looking over the counter, right inside the kitchen.


"I am a Devil apparently. The Daemons from your world are different but then again I haven't met any to give an exact difference between us."


"My world?"


"This restaurant operates between several worlds. I am not from your world."


"What! Really?" Her eyes glittered as I brought out some of the chocolate for the dish. "Ehh, what is that? Looks and smells amazing. Can I eat some? Hey, can I eat some?"


"Umm, Milim-sama please wait on your seat. The dish will be served as soon as Silas-sama is done." Shuna came to the rescue.


"Rimuru, I want it now. I want that sweet thing he is using, now."


"Sure, we can get you one of those but that would be it. You cannot eat the dishes after that." Rimuru explained with his hands spread out.


"Ehh? Why?"


...  


Is she really a Demon Lord?


My impression of Demon Lords is going down very quickly.


"NO! I WANT IT NOW." She stomped on the ground and I sensed a massive amount of power behind me.


This power made that clown look like a candle compared to the sun.


Fuck.


I took a deep breath to reorganise myself from the sudden surprise.


I took control of the shop and the very next instant, her power was dispelled as she looked around in surprise.


"This shop is a place for people to enjoy their food and good food needs time to be cooked. Do you want me to give you raw food which tastes like crap? If so, then I can get it to you in a minute."


That did the job as she sat down quickly although with a pout.


Really? That easily?


The power of a God with the mind of a child.


Such a dangerous combination. Seriously, how do you even deal with someone like this?


The fact that Tohru of all people said. “B-boss, that girl is dangerous. Don’t mess with her.” was a testament to her power level.


Tohru was someone who didn’t back down from any fights and had even fought Gods in her world and yet Milim’s presence made her back away.


I decided to heed her warning and work on the dish with all my concentration.


The girl in the meantime was playing games with Saitama and Rimuru while I prepared the dishes.


I served the first dish as soon as possible.


Lièvre À La Royale. The same dish I had served to my customers as an apology.


She practically jumped on the plate and I got some time to cook the other dishes.


It was only after three whole hours that she was satisfied and I could sit down in peace.


The guests had more or less left the place except for Rimuru and his party.


"Oi, Devil." She got up on the chair, hands on her waist as she looked directly at me.


"Hmm."


"Work for me."


"No thanks."


"What? Why?"


"I enjoy working here. I meet many people from different worlds, visit different places and make new friends from everywhere. I don't want to leave this job."


"But that's not fair. I wanna have fun too." She cried.


"Then you can come and visit me anytime you want." I shrugged. By this time I had gotten a read on her personality and understood how to deal with her.


She was like a kid.


Exactly like a kid.


"Yes yes, I can bring you here to visit Silas whenever you want." Rimuru came up for my backup.


"Really? Promise?"


"Promise." Both me and Rimuru said at the same time.


I accompanied her out till Tempest and even packed an entire chocolate cake for her making her light up instantly.


"You know what Devil? I like you. I will call you Sil."


And just like that, my demonic power soared and all I could think about before blacking out was...  Not again.


Requirements for Evolution have been met.


Starting Evolution.


Rare Skill: Water Manipulation has evolved into Unique Skill: Flood.


Rare Skill: Ice manipulation has evolved into Unique Skill: Frost.


Extra Skill Gained: Water Resistance


Extra Skill Gained: Fire Resistance


Extra Skill Gained: Cold Resistance


Extra Skill Gained: Shock Resistance


Extra Skills: Water Resistance, Fire Resistance, Cold Resistance and Shock Resistance were combined to All Elemental Resistance.


Extra Skill Gained: High Speed Regeneration.


Extra Skill Gained: Physical Damage Resistance.


Extra Skill Gained: Greater Magic Resistance


Extra Skill Gained: Corruption Resistance


Extra Skill Gained: Spiritual Damage Resistance


Evolution to Arch Daemon successful.


I opened my eyes to find myself in Shuna's lap and she was brushing my hair. I was still in the Restaurant but there were no other people there.


"How many days was I out this time? I asked, not even trying to get up. "What about the guests?"


"Eight hours. We closed the shop for the day. We didn't have many guests after that."


“Did Milim leave?” I asked.


“She is staying in Tempest for the time being.” Shuna replied and I saw a strained smile on her face.


“Did something happen?”


“Well, after you passed out, Tohru-chan thought you were hurt and almost attacked Milim-sama. She was stopped at the right time by Rimuru-sama but she was very angry. She only stopped when she found out that you were actually evolving and not exactly hurt.”


... 


I won’t lie but I felt quite warm knowing that she did that especially since I knew she was shit scared of Milim’s power.


“Milim didn’t get angry, did she?” I asked, suddenly remembering the actual demon lord in the basket.


“No. She just laughed it off and even praised Tohru-chan. She said you had good subordinates and that she would let everything go for two chocolate cakes.”


... 


She was really a child.


I shook my head at the antics of the little Demon Lord.


“What about Sakura and Lavy?”


“They haven’t returned yet.”


“I see.” Thank goodness they haven’t returned or they would be worried for no reason.


“Thank you for taking care of the situation, Shuna." I smiled at her.


"It's my job." She replied with a smile.


I closed my eyes and lay there resting for a while.


Shuna’s scent felt nice. She smelled sweet, like cherry blossoms.


I suddenly remembered what Lavy had told me about Shuna last night and suddenly the whole situation felt quite intimate.


Was she really interested in me?


“Shuna.”


“Yes?’


“Tell me something about yourself, about your life in the Ogre Village.”


“Eh?”


“I want to know more about you.” I said seriously and saw the girl blush.


The lights in the Restaurant were dim but my senses were extremely sharp after evolving. Seeing in the dark was nothing, I could do so earlier too.


But now, it was on a whole other level.


I had thought that my evolution to a Daemon Chevalier had made me stronger but all that was nothing compared to what I was feeling right now.


This evolution… it was something… far deeper as if something fundamental has changed about me.


I’ll have to ask Rimuru later on.


Arch Daemon.


Sounds like the Demon version of Archangels.


But still, how freaking strong was Milim?


We had to fight and risk our lives and even then my previous evolution had occurred due to me accidentally eating that Clown’s soul and Milim pushed me further with just simple naming. Moreover while Rimuru was weakened by naming the ogres, she didn’t even look like she was breathing heavily.


Demon Lords were scary.


No wonder, Tohru was so scared of her.


Thankfully, it looked like she was quite easygoing and didn’t take it to heart.


I shook my head and snapped out of these thoughts.


Shuna was telling me her story and I didn’t want to think about other things while she was pouring her heart out to me.


- Zeref -


He waited in the room as the door was opened and a figure entered. The figure paused looking at him, his eyes widening but he still let out a sigh and sat down.


"I didn't think I would ever see you again. Not that I am unhappy. It brings back some nostalgic memories of my youth but why are you here, Zeref?"


"Warrod. You look…"


"Old, like a tree? Yes. Magic is strange. I can't say I dislike this form of mine. Rather I find myself much closer to nature."


"I was going to say well but… I need your help, Warrod."


….


He didn't answer but looked questioningly.


"I found a way to remove the curse of contradiction. I am free now."


Warrod Sequen was probably one of the only people in Ishgar who knew about him and the truth about the Black Wizard Zeref so the fact that the man's eyes widened and his jaws hung open was not a big surprise.


"Are you?"


"Yes. I am here to take her back."


"They will not allow you to step foot in Ishgar. Your name is…."


"And yet I stand here. You know as well as I do that if I really wanted to push, they cannot stop me. But I don't wish for any bloodshed. Not anymore. I just wish to take Mavis away with me and free her of her curse. In return, I will remove Tartarus and all the demons inside it. This is my offer to you. Should the Magic Council refuse it, even the Etherion or Face will not be able to save you, this… I promise."


A tense atmosphere descended on the room.


"Let her decide what she wants to do. I will ask Makarov. We will meet on Tenroujima Island in a week."


"Very well."


"Zeref… Precht, he…"


"Hmm?"


"Went rogue. He is now the leader of a Dark Guild working together with Tartarus."


"... I see."


He got up and was about to leave the room when he heard the voice of Warrod once more. "Congratulations on being free, Zeref."


“Thank you, old friend.”


– Irene –


She looked at the bunch of children behind her, following one who looked like a miniature version of her.


She never thought that there would be a day where she would be able to return for her daughter again.


And yet, when the day comes, she is afraid to even call out to her.


Being able to taste food again had done a lot of good for her. Especially when she discovered the fact that she could sleep after eating the food from the restaurant. The voices in her head started to become quieter.


She was regaining her lost sanity bit by bit and this reignited her hope of reuniting with her daughter.


And what does she see when she comes back?


Her daughter, enslaved and forced to work by some cultists? The audacity.


Behind them lay the smouldering wreckage of the Tower of Heaven. A way to resurrect Zeref, the black haired girl had claimed. What foolishness!


How would you revive someone who is already alive?


They were obviously being used by someone, the one called Precht.


"I assume you will be taking care of Tartarus?" She asked Zeref who was sitting on a rock nearby, waiting for them.


"August found a child with an innate Satan Soul Take Over Magic. He wants her to devour the magic of the ones in Tartarus for her growth." He looked at the children behind her. "Congratulations on finding your daughter."


She froze. The children behind her froze as she looked back.


Her daughter was staring at her with shock on her face.


She had the urge to glare at Zeref but then again, it made things a lot easier for her by breaking the ice between the two of them.


She turned back to Zeref. "The person behind this was the second Guild Master of Fairy Tail, Precht. He was manipulating the children to build the tower. I will take care of him myself."


He thought for a moment before answering. "Take August with you. He is related to Tartarus. August will take care of that side." She nodded.


"And you?"


"You have reunited with your family. It's about time I got reunited with mine as well."


- Tsunade -


“Has Sensei finally gone over the edge?” She asked as she stepped under the gates of the village which she had vowed never to return.

“I warn you Tsunade, Sensei was not his usual easy going self the last time I met him. You should watch how you speak in front of him.” Jiraiya warned, seriously making her grit her teeth.


“Or what? It’s not like I have anything to lose. What can he do to me either way?” She rolled her eyes.


This village had already taken everything from her.


She didn’t have anything left to lose anymore so she wasn’t afraid of what the old man might do.


While they walked, she saw several people looking in her direction and speaking to themselves. Apart from that she even noticed a strange atmosphere, a strange tension of sorts in the village.


In fact, she had felt some unkind gazes from unseen corners of the village.


Has the friction between the village and the Uchiha clan reached this point already? 


Was that why she was called back right now, because there could be a war anytime?


As they walked towards the Hokage building, she saw a few familiar faces. No, calling them familiar would be a stretch as they had changed a lot with age.


“Kakashi, Guy.” Jiraiya greeted them.


“Jiraiya-sama, Tsunade-sama.” The two bowed.


“Off to a mission again? You should take a break sometimes” Jiraiya asked Kakashi and Tsunade remembered more about the boy.


Kakashi Hatake, the son of the White Fang, Sakumo Hatake and the student of the Fourth Hokage, Minato Namikaze.


The boy’s eyes looked dead. Then again, so did many other people’s.


It was the ones who could remain in this profession and still keep their sanity who were the odd ones.


“I have just returned from a mission and am on my way to the Hokage Tower to report.”


“Oh, come then. We were going to report to sensei too.”


Kakashi nodded and looked at Guy “Then I will be off, Guy.”


“Very well, Kakashi, my friend. I can take you to my favourite Restaurant next time.” The guy in the green jumpsuit shouted loud enough to make Tsunade check her ear drums for any damages.


“Sure sure.” Kakashi waved off and followed them.


“Has there been any updates since I left the village”? Jiraiya asked, while they were walking towards the Hokage tower.


Kakashi shook his head, looking more… dead somehow as if that was even possible.


Tsunade looked confused at them not knowing the topic of their discussion.


“Anything on your end?” Kakashi asked and Jiraiya also shook his head looking tired.


“Has something happened?” She asked, her curiosity getting the best of her.


“You will know when we are inside.” Jiraiya said, cryptically.


She nodded and in minutes, they were already at the Hokage’s tower.


Jiraiya knocked on the door and a familiar voice answered it.


“Come in.”


On entering the door, she saw her sensei again, after over a decade. He seemed so old and frail all of a sudden. How long had it been again?


The old man smiled. “It’s good to have you back, Tsunade.”


His voice broke her thoughts and her eyebrows scrunched. “I wish I could say the same but I have no good feelings about returning to this place again.”


She saw his face shift through several emotions, first sadness, then helplessness and guilt and finally resolve.


“Then I am afraid that you will have to make do with it. I have given you more than enough time to recuperate, far more than anyone else. It’s time you dealt with your problems once and for all.”


She was taken aback at his words. She had never seen him behave like this.


After shock came anger.


“I am retired.”


“Shinobi only retire when they are dead.” He replied, his voice cold. “The village needs your assistance at this time. I cannot allow you to throw your tantrums anymore.”


She gritted her teeth but didn’t reply. The old man was just like he had been during the wars, the one which had earned him the title of a God of Shinobi.


“What exactly has been going on in the village? What is so important that you have forced me to come here again?” Finally taking a breath, she asked.


….


….


….


….


“Konoha is on the verge of a Civil War and I need your help to stop it.”


And just like that all her hopes of sneaking away were crushed altogether.

title: The Book: Chapter 3: First Harvest
content:
Ruling by the Book


Disclaimer: I own nothing


Chapter 3: First Harvest


______________________________________________________________________


- Kazuya -


I walked with Grandpa toward the fields, our guards following us.


Behind them were several nobles who were following us at a distance, most of them sweating from just a bit of walking and slowing us down.


“Remind me why we are doing this again?” I asked Grandpa.


“You need to show your achievements to the court so that they trust you and your decisions more. It will help establish your voice in the entire land and shut down those who might plan to raise voices against your rule.” He said as he looked around.


I nodded.


“Reputation and trust are a great thing, Kazu-kun. As long as you have a good reputation and trust in the hearts of people, people would even die for you with a single word. It’s the biggest power of a Daimyo. We don’t rely on strength otherwise what would be the difference between us and the Kages of the Ninja Villages? What a good daimyo must rule over is not the lands of the people but their hearts.”


“Yes, Grandpa.”


As we talked, we reached the lands and I saw him stop and stare at the fields. Taking a look at him, a smile crept on my face at his stunned looking face.


“I had heard of the reports but this….just how in the world did you do it?” He asked in a surprised voice.


“A combination of knowledge and hard work.” I smiled and walked forward towards the group of people who had gathered by Kensho and Kuina. “My people. In these last four months, you have worked hard. Every day and night, you have used your blood and sweat to grow these crops. Today….we reap the fruits of our hard work. Are you ready?”


“Yes!” They shouted at once.


“Good. Then let’s get to work. After work, I have a grand feast organised for all of you so that you all can relax after months of hard work.”


The crowd cheered at this and I smiled.


“Oh and one last thing, the competition from before….is still on.”


Those were the last words needed for the group to get to work at their fastest.


While they worked, I was not sitting idly either.


The nobles had all surrounded me, asking me about the methods and what we could do to improve the productivity of the crops of their lands.


Grandpa left the discussions to me. His words were that I needed to learn to take care of things myself.


I was able to negotiate the rights for those methods for some trade benefits and support from the nobles, nothing excessive but enough for me and my plans.


The harvesting process was completed by evening and even the weighing of the produce was completed.


The total harvest was two and a half times greater than before, a result which was completely unheard of around here.


I rewarded the winners twenty percent extra pay on top of their promised wages and they were quite happy.


And even after all that, the entire harvest went to my personal funds as Grandpa had promised. This should be enough to support my plans to support the kids for a year at least. Once things calm down, I will have to send Saitō to sell some of the gold and jewels I had summoned for cash to buy other necessary stuff for them.


With the immense success of the new methods, Grandpa officially appointed me as the one in charge of all of the Daimyo’s lands to do as I please and none of the nobles protested either. Hell, some of them even offered their own lands for experiments.


Profits from this were enough to turn anyone’s heads.


That night I went back to my warehouse.


Today was the day I was planning to work on medicines.


The medicinal herbs brought by Grandpa were necessary for the whole process. These medicines could assist in the growth of the body, increase vitality, boost physical fitness and chakra growth to some extent and even improve bloodline abilities.


In the Shinobi World, there was a reason why the Clans were always ahead of normal shinobi. In this world, you either have some special bloodlines or the heritage of hundreds of years or there is almost no chance for you to rise to the top.


I mean, even in anime, all the endgame people were all descendants of the Otsutsuki.


Sure Might Guy could temporarily reach that level but even just that much led him to almost dying if not for Naruto magically saving him in the end.


But not everyone is Might Guy. Not everyone could push themselves to that extent otherwise there would be plenty of Eight Gates users in Root.


Would someone like Danzo care for their pain and exhaustion?


No, he would be happy if one person among hundreds could get that result.


These medicines will help strengthen the bodies of my people and then I will plan on teaching them how to open the first gate at the very least.


Even with just that, they could reach Chunin levels of strength if matched with the Samurai Training of Iron Nation.


One hundred chunin levels would be enough to start a small village and a good starting level for protecting my land.


Moreover, these medicines can also be used by Grandpa and could increase his vitality.


As for me?


Rituals gave me much better results at a faster pace.


To be honest, if I wanted to, I could have become stronger if I used some of the crazier rituals but even the thoughts about those churned my stomach and made me start to lose my faith in humanity and this is something I was saying after using three genins for my rituals.


I shook my head clearing my thoughts.


While some of the rituals I had chosen were cruel, I made it a point to never cross a line. Obviously I was no saint. I knew I had to take many questionable decisions in my post as the Daimyo of my Land and get my hands dirty too but I had sworn not to cross some lines.


Thankfully, the Grimoire understood my problem and gave me several options. I had chosen some comparatively tamer rituals.


For example, to gain the bloodlines of other people, there were rituals like the one done in anime by Hiruko turning me into a zombie look-alike like the guy himself. Or there was another better ritual in which I had to become a part of their clan, their family through….a tantric ritual.


Basically, I had to marry the member of the clan whose powers I wanted and consummate the marriage.


And wasn’t this quiet convenient.


Daimyo were known to take wives from shinobi clans too and the clans agreed as well to create relationships and bonds with Daimyo to expand businesses.


I could just find a wife from the Uzumaki, Uchiha and Senju clans and get the genetic lottery if I wanted to.


Of course, there was also the option of getting the members of these clans and sacrificing them but I had nowhere near the power to pull something like that.


But obviously these actions will attract too much attention towards me.


Not only of the villages but also from the hidden darkness of this world….Zetsu.


The stronger the ritual, the more costly the ingredients. That’s why all this needed to be done with the utmost secrecy.


I was still an insignificant ant in this world. I can’t attract any attention to myself.


________________________________x_____________________________________


“Those damned Stairs bastards.” I cursed as I read the Grimoire.


“What?” Kuina asked, looking from her own book.


I didn’t answer and looked at the Grimoire once more.


Two months had passed since the day of the harvest and in this time, I had collected the information about the Stairs Daimyo and his family including the girl who was proposed to be married to me and I did find some crazy things which made it clear to me why they were going so far as to merge their land with ours and even absolve the position of the Stairs Daimyo. Turns out that they had their eyes set up on our lands from the very beginning.


And it wasn’t just them but also the Medicine guys who were secretly backing them up, having a stake in the whole plan.


The Stairs Daimyo had a son who had an official wife and five concubines. The daughter from his main wife was married to the grandson of the Medicine Daimyo while the one proposed to marry me was the ostracised daughter he had with a woman of common birth. Her mother wasn’t even recognised as a wife and was disposed off while the girl was treated as a pariah.

Three of them were still alive although barely.


We already had two chunins captured in our cells. If I can get two more, I could do another ritual.


To be honest, I wasn’t sure I could capture Chunins so easily until my people were a bit stronger so I had left this ritual on the backburner. Soul Rituals always took an insane amount of materials.


Sure I could kill the Uzumaki too but I had no intention of doing so. I wanted to establish friendly relationships with them. They could be of much greater help if my plan works.


With this thought in mind, I began talking with them, introducing them to the city as we walked back home.
