title: Story 11: Chapter 1: New Life, New Job
content:
My Isekai Rom-com Life is weird!!!


Disclaimer: I own nothing


Chapter 1: New Life, New Job


______________________________________________________________________


- ??? -


In my previous life, I had often wondered how getting isekai’d would feel if it ever happened to me. Would it be the same as being summoned to another world to fight a Demon King or something?


All that cliche about joining the adventurer’s guild, building a party and fighting some world ending danger….yeah, the thought turned me off.


Man, if I wanted a next life, I wanted something where I could relax or chill. I had no intention of risking my life as those isekai protagonists.


Why should I go and fight their battles for them?


They should go and do that themselves.


Perhaps the only thing which appealed to me in those stories was the harem part. I mean, I was a normal guy after all.


The reality however is that isekai is….extremely boring.


At least my Isekai Adventures was not one which could be made into a novel.


Hell, I didn’t even have any of the so-called cheat powers which were the staple of the Isekai anime troupes.


I did have the memories of my previous life so I guess it was not all bad.


It did help me stay ahead of most of the people of my age and excel at anything I tried. I couldn’t call my life very great but it wasn’t bad either. If anything it was the prime example of average.


I was born in a lower middle class family with loving parents. They have supported me by sending me to study in a big city despite having financial difficulties of their own which is more than I was expecting. For this I am and will be eternally grateful to them.


To be honest, I wasn’t even sure that this world was different from my own because the places in this world were all the same, similar history as well.


My only clue was the people with different colours of hair and eyes which looked to be straight out of some anime.


In my last life, I was a businessman dealing mainly with stocks and while that life brought me money, it also distanced me away from my friends and family due to my busy schedule. In the end, when I was suffering from terminal cancer in a hospital, the only people who even came to visit me were my parents.


None of those so-called friends or business partners showed up for me.


On the other hand, my dad who was just a simple teacher had his students visit him regularly even when he had retired. They talked and laughed with him and shared their achievements with him whenever they had time.


Back then I had often rolled my eyes at such things. My thoughts being that only money helped in the end but I was wrong. I didn’t want to experience such a life ever again.


It was during those times that I watched anime and manga to spend my time, taking some time to spend on myself and my family and I won’t lie, despite my inevitable end coming near, those were some of the most peaceful days of my life.


My experience with the stocks and the possible future knowledge helped me earn quite a bit on the side so I decided to follow my father’s example and became….a teacher.


And that’s what brought me to this place.


I looked at the gates of the posh looking building that was the Kuoh Academy, in a small town near Tokyo.


The town was quiet and peaceful and the school was offering a well paying job so I accepted it.


I looked around and saw the students, mainly girls staring at me as I walked towards the school building.


In fact, nine out of ten students were girls.


Kuoh Academy had turned co-ed this year after being a girls school for years and so the numbers were understandable. In fact, I was one of the first male teachers to be recruited here.


The funny thing was that I could see the blushes on the faces of the girls as they giggled and talked among themselves while spying looks at me.


….teenagers.


Then again, their behaviour was also understandable.


I was my age. In fact, I was only a few years older than some of these girls at twenty one years of age.


My experiences and knowledge of my previous life helped me complete my studies very quickly. For this reason, I was far younger than any other teacher in this school. Many of these girls could mistake me for a senior if I were to wear their school uniform.


Now, where is the Principal’s Office?


I looked around and spotted a girl in glasses. She had long black hair and a no nonsense look on her face. Perhaps the most eye-catching thing about her were her eyes. Heterochromia, quite a rare trait.


But the thing which had attracted me was the badge on her chest. The vice president of the Student Council.


“Excuse me?” I called out to her.


The girl was a bit surprised by my call and looked at me. “Yes?”


“Could you please point me in the direction of the Principal’s office?”


“Yes. Are you new to this school? A transfer student?” She asked, making me chuckle.


She looked confused so I answered her question.


“I am indeed new to this school but I am not a student. My name is Takashi Furukawa and I am a new teacher in this school. This is my first day.”


Her eyes widened and she quickly bowed. “My apologies, Furukawa-Sensei.”


“Don’t mind. Now, could you please show me the way?”


“Yes. Let me lead you, I am going to the Student Council room in the same direction.”


“Thank you, Miss….?”


“Tsubaki, Shinra Tsubaki.”


“Miss Shinra then.”


The girl led me towards the Student Council room while I questioned her about some things about the school and the girl herself.


I came to know that she was a second year student who was elected as the Vice President of the Kuoh Academy by the student’s votes, a great achievement. Student Council President and Vice President were generally elected from among the third years. In fact even the President was a second year student. I guess they must be quite famous. And from the looks and frequent greetings of the students towards the girl and even some of the stink eyed looks thrown towards me from the male students, I could tell that my guess was not that far off the mark.


It seems that she was quite well liked by everyone in the school.


We reached the Principal’s office soon enough.


“Thank you, Miss Shinra.” I nodded towards the girl who bowed towards me formally.


Ah, well mannered girl. Nice.


Minutes later, I was having a meeting with the Principal who was impressed with my academic achievements and was more than glad to have me as a teacher in the school. He welcomed me and gave me a run down of my duties and even personally brought me to introduce me to the rest of the teachers.


It turned out that the previous teacher had to leave for a different country after marriage and the post was vacant.


That would explain the urgent hiring, I guess.


The school had a Middle School part attached to it but I was assigned to teach in the High School classes.


And thus started my life as a Teacher in Kuoh Academy.


I hope I can relax and work here.


_________________________________x____________________________________


My eyes twitched as I looked at the one in front of me.


“I am sorry, I think I misheard you. Could you repeat that again?” I asked, truly doubting her words.


“Will you please go out with me?” The girl repeated again, unbothered by my question but I could see the blush on her face. She was embarrassed.


Just how did it come to this?


I mean sure I had received a love letter a day ago but for someone to come out and say it to my face like this was astonishing.


“Miss Gremory, if you are being forced by someone to do this, you can tell me. I will help you out. But if this is a game of dare or something similar, I will treat this time as a joke and request that you do not make a habit of this.” I replied in a calm and collected tone.


“No! I am not being forced by anyone nor is this a game. I am asking you out because I l-like you.” She replied blushing.


….


….


….


….


“I see. While I am flattered by your feelings towards me, I will have to politely decline your request. I am sorry.”


Her mouth opened in shock as if it was really that shocking for a teacher to reject romantic advances from a student.


Alright, I will accept that she was beautiful. Actually screw that, she was downright gorgeous, especially the crimson hair framing her perfect face and a figure which was completely beyond her years. Let me repeat, Rias Gremory was drop dead gorgeous. I could see why she was the most famous girl in the school, one of the so-called four great Onee-sama’s of the school, a title which I couldn’t for the life of me wrap my head around.


But a relationship between teacher and a student was frowned upon by society and was completely forbidden in most places too.


I have no intention of pushing my nose in such a mess.


- Rias Gremory -


She felt her face burning from embarrassment as she hurried back to the Old School Building and locked herself in her room and screamed in her pillow, letting out all her embarrassment. She could still feel her ears get hot when she recalled the incident from minutes ago.


Thank Satans, there was no one else around due to the barrier she had set or she wouldn’t be able to show her face around the school for a few days.


“Ughhh, it better be worth it.” She raised and a virtual screen appeared in front of her eyes. Written on the screen was the quest.


Tutorial Quest: Baby Steps


Every long journey begins with baby steps. To get into someone’s heart you have to state your intention first. 


Objective: Ask your teacher, Takashi Furukawa out on a date.


Bonus Objective: Have him accept.


Reward: Demonic Power doubled, Basic Answers


Bonus Reward: +5 Levels in the Power of Destruction


Failure: Become known as Switch Princess(Boob Princess), End of the World.


Note: No magic affecting the mind should be used on the target. If ignored, the consequences….will be extremely dire.


Tutorial Quest cannot be rejected.


Her eyes twitched at the Quest.


She sincerely hoped she was not hallucinating or this was not a prank on her by someone or she would be throwing using them for practice for her Power of Destruction.


Quest Completed.


Congratulations on completing your tutorial quest!


Would you like to receive your reward?


Yes/No.


“Yes.” She called out, expecting something to pop out reveal the prank and yet there was some part of her which truly wished for this to be real.


It was a System after all. The same one from all those manga, novels and anime she had seen and read. What were the chances?


For a moment nothing happened and she was disappointed but before she could think of anything else, she felt a change in her body.


Her Demonic Power surged uncontrollably and it kept on rising before stopping after a certain point.


Stunned, she checked her state to find that her demonic power had indeed doubled.


“This is….real?” A whisper came out of her lips because even when the proof was right in front of her, she was finding it hard to believe.


She didn’t know anything which could increase someone’s demonic power like this.


Her mind went back to how all this had started, two days ago.


- Flashback -


She had woken up to see a screen in front of her eyes and thought she was still sleeping and all of it was probably a dream of some kind.


“Do you want to have the power to change your fate?”


“Yes/No”


In her sleepy state, she clicked the yes option and closed her eyes again.


It was only when her eyes opened after some time and the screen had not disappeared that she was completely roused from her sleepy state and stared at the screen in front of her.


Welcome, Rias Gremory


Congratulations on gaining a chance to change your fate.


“What is this?”


Was someone using magic on her while she was asleep?


She quickly used several spells to check herself and even tried to dispel the magic but to no avail.


Every check showed a negative result.


A pit grew in her stomach and she hurried out.


“Akeno! Where are you?” She called out her best friend and queen.


“Yes, what is it?” Akeno asked, coming out of her room.


Can you see this? She tried to speak but couldn’t. Her body would just not move at her command. It terrified her.


“Rias?”


“Eh!”


“Is something the matter?”


“Umm….no. I….was just wondering if you have any contracts today.”


“Yes. In fact I do.”


“Oh, well, good luck on that.” She quickly replied and returned back to her room.


Back inside her room, she tried to understand the situation properly.


In front of Akeno, she couldn’t utter a word when she tried to speak about the screen but was free to speak when she was talking about something else.


She suddenly got an idea and got a pen and a paper and tried to write about the screen on the paper and sure enough her hands refused to move.


….


What kind of magic is this?


That day she skipped school and tried everything she could to understand this….whatever it was.


By the end of the day she had come to the conclusion that this was like no other type of magic she had seen or heard about. She couldn’t find a single clue about it even in the DevilNet. Was it even magic?


Finally, out of every option, she tried to explore the screen to find out more.


The layout of the entire thing was quite simple. In fact, it was similar to a game.


First there was the status page in which information about her was given.


Name: Rias Gremory

Rank: Tier 4

Skills: Power of Destruction (Lv. 32), Devil Magic(Lv. 29), Mind Magic(Lv. 29),....

Quests

Inventory


Level 32 Power of Destruction?


How were these powers scaled?


What did Tier 4 mean?


Unfortunately there were no answers.


Just as she was thinking this, a new screen appeared in front of her eyes.


Tutorial Quest: Baby Steps


Every long journey begins with baby steps. To get into someone’s heart you have to state your intention first. 


Objective: Ask your teacher, Takashi Furukawa out on a date.


Bonus Objective: Have him accept.


Reward: Demonic Power doubled, Basic Answers


Bonus Reward: +5 Levels in the Power of Destruction


Failure: Become known as Switch Princess(Boob Princess), End of the World.


Note: No magic affecting the mind should be used on the target. If ignored, the consequences….will be extremely dire.


Tutorial Quest cannot be rejected.


….what?


Her eyes went over the whole thing and her eyes twitched hard.


What’s up with this ridiculous quest?


And what the hell is with that Failure Penalty?


Who in their right mind would call her Boob Princess….?


But most of all, how in the seven heavens is her not asking her sensei out on a date going to lead to the end of the world?


- End of Flashback -


Turns out that all of this was actually true.


This….System was indeed something which could grant powers and even increase Demonic Power out of nowhere.


Then was the failure penalty actually true?


Possible end of the world!


She quickly opened the menu again.


“Give me the Bonus Rewards.” She called out to the screen and sure enough, information appeared on the screen about the future.


‘As the world is going right now, it will meet its end at the hands of Alien Gods who will invade this planet in the future. This world will be able to offer no resistance against their power. Even the commanders of the invaders will have the power to take down Great Red in single combat.’


Her heart chilled at the information.


‘To prevent this you are given a chance. With the help of this System, you can gain enough power to not only resist this invasion but also overcome it with ease. So complete the quests. Good Luck.’


‘PS. According to your original fate, you would have married a boob obsessed guy along with over a dozen other girls and be known as the Switch Princess by the whole Supernatural world, princess because your so-called husband would gain power by publicly groping your boobs. You would have then died with your whole family during the invasion. Seriously Host, get your game together.’


Main Quest Issued


Objective: Within the next dozen years become the wife of Takashi Furukawa.


Reward: Happiness


Failure: Possible End of the World.


Note: Using magic or threats will not be appreciated and will have extremely dire consequences. Be warned.


Main Quest cannot be rejected.


….


….


….


….


“What the hell?!”


Just what do you mean by the quest and what the hell kind of the future was that?


Getting married to some….some creep with dozens of other girls and then dying with all her family.


Why in the world would she marry that kind of creep?


Suddenly her face paled.


Was it Riser?


Of course she disliked his attitude towards her but even he couldn’t be that bad, could he?


But he already had around a dozen girls in his peerage, and she was pretty sure he was sleeping with each one of them….was the System talking about him?


“Oi give me more answers, dammit. This was not enough.” She tried asking the System but to no avail. There were no answers.


Instead something else appeared in front of her.


Quest Issued


It was observed that Takashi Furukawa eats takeouts for all his meals. Such food is not healthy.


Objective: Prepare a bento for him and have him taste it.


Reward: Random Skill


Failure: Slightly Bad Luck for 1 week.


Accept Quest: Y/N.


….why is every quest focused on Takashi-sensei?


‘Host doesn’t have sufficient clearance to know the answer. Please work harder.’


….


- Takashi -


I reached home, still wondering about the incident with Rias Gremory.


Two months had passed since I had joined this school and my time till now had been smooth sailing.


The students here were well behaved and actually took their studies seriously. Kuoh Academy was actually one of the premiere institutes of the country so this much was expected. Perhaps the only thing which embarrassed me a bit were the looks the girls threw me sometimes. Dammit, I looked too young.


For this reason, I started growing a beard to look a bit older but this only made them fawn even more.


Seriously, these girls are too horny for their own good sometimes. That said, they had never come out and done something like this


I shook my head, shaking off these thoughts. “Maybe, it was just them playing some kind of game?”


Yeah, I couldn’t think of any other reason.


“Now, what to eat tonight?” I sighed, facing a much bigger problem than some teenage girl confessing her feelings to me. What to cook for dinner?


I, despite the experiences of both my lives, have always sucked at cooking.


I don’t know why.


I mean I did try to learn something to cook for myself but the salt and pepper always rebelled in my hands and fire always urged me to try my fire bending skills on it….and I, being the weak mortal that I am, gave in to those feelings.


And what can I say, the few pieces of chicken legs never stood a chance against my peerless fire bending skills and got reduced to ashes.


Sigh….such is the loneliness of the strong. Fated to forever live a life where they cannot enjoy a meal made by their own hands….except cereal. Boiling milk was no problem.


But cereal for dinner was not something I could eat.


I was new to this place so I hadn’t hired any maids to cook. I guess I will have to go out and eat. I couldn’t stand eating instant ramen another day.


With that in mind, I put on my coat and left my house.


_________________________________x____________________________________


Kuoh was a very quiet place, away from the hustle and bustle of Tokyo and yet not isolated so there were amenities of all types available nearby.


I looked around the place and found a small restaurant nearby and had my dinner there.


Looking at the time, I decided to go out for a walk to look around the place and know where everything was.


Deciding to rest for a while in the park before going back, I heard something nearby and turned to the side to see a black cat sitting on the bench and staring at me.


“Hey there. Are you out for a walk after dinner too?” I joked, slowly going forward to pat its head. To my surprise, the cat didn’t shy away and actually enjoyed the ministrations.


The cat’s reactions made me smile as she tried to paw at my hand when I tried tickling her. I guess I was always a cat person after all.


I picked the cat up and brought her to my lap, playing with her. “Such a good girl, aren’t you?” Is she domesticated?


Because with how relaxed she was with me, she didn’t seem to be a wild cat.


“Did you get lost?” But then again, there are no collars on her.


The cat was however not interested in any of this and just pawed at my hands, still busy with playing.


She looked adorable.


“Well, if you have nowhere to go, would you like to come with me?” I asked and the cat suddenly stopped and stared at me, her golden eyes staring into mine.


Wait….she understood?


Was this really a stray cat and not domesticated?


Eh, in any case, I will just return her in case I find anyone searching for her.


There was a chance that something might happen to her if I left her alone outside.


“Good then. Come with me. I have milk and cookies. Oh God, that sounds so wrong.” I laughed at my own joke.


The cat seemed to laugh in my arms too.


“Oh, you like my joke? Sigh, such a good girl. Not many seem to appreciate my sense of humour. Alright come, let’s get you home for a bath and some food.”


I carried the cat and walked back towards my home. On the way, I made sure to pick up something for her.


“Now, what do I call you? Hmm, let me think. Okay, how about Yoruichi?” I suddenly remembered the figure of one of my favourite anime characters from my previous life.


“Nyaa~”


“Yoruichi is one of my favourite anime characters. She was actually a Shinigami and could turn into a cat….” And with that I walked back home talking to her all the way.


Looks like I won’t be living alone in my home anymore.


- Kuroka -


She looked at the figure sleeping in front of her and considered what to do next.


Everything started when a screen appeared in front of her all of a sudden few days ago.


“Do you want power to change your fate?” It had asked.


She had considered it a joke or some kind from that Monkey Bikou and agreed to it and that’s how she was stuck in all this mess.


Tutorial Quest - Baby Steps


The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step. You however are no ordinary being. You are a predator. You approach what you want with full confidence and take it for yourself. 


Objective: Kiss Takashi Furukawa


Bonus: Have him kiss you.


Reward: Demonic Power will be doubled.


Bonus Reward: +5 levels Senjutsu Proficiency, Basic Answers


Failure: Your sister falls in love with a pervert for beating you up, Possible end of the World.


Note: No magic affecting the mind should be used on the target. If ignored, the consequences….will be extremely dire.


Tutorial Quests cannot be rejected.


….


Motherfuc….what the hell is that penalty?


She had raged so hard when she had seen the penalty for the first time.


Possible End of the World was scary for sure but what was with that oddly specific bit of penalty about Shirone?


Unfortunately, she had no power to do anything to this….screen or System or whatever. It was something far beyond her power, so much so that not even Ophis could see it.


Her status page could tell everything about her powers.


Name: Kuroka

Rank: Tier 5

Skills: Senjutsu(Lv 43), Touki(Lv 29),  Devil Magic(Lv. 35), Mind Magic(Lv. 32),....

Quests

Inventory


This scared her.


But it also gave her hope.


What if the rewards were indeed real? Could she really get stronger?


The System was kind enough to point her in the direction of the mentioned guy but for the life of her, she couldn’t understand why he was so special.


He didn’t look anything special, perhaps except the slightly above average amount of Magic Power for a human.


At least he was good when scratching behind her ears.


She had decided to watch over him for a while and see what kind of guy he was and all she was normal.


Except for his relatively young age for being a teacher, he was extremely normal.


It was only after this that she decided to approach him in her disguise.


Who would have thought that she would get picked up so easily?


And apparently just licking his face also counted as a kiss and him kissing her forehead in her cat form counted as a kiss from him. Just like that she had completed the tutorial quest….so easy.


She looked at him again and verified that he was sleeping and slowly left the room and came to the living room.


Changing back to her normal form, she selected to complete the quest, slightly wary of what to expect.


What she didn’t expect was for her Demonic Power to suddenly start rising.


She quickly threw around some barriers to isolate herself and protect the house or every devil in the town would be knocking on the doors of the apartment within minutes.


The feeling was intoxicating and she couldn’t help but moan in pleasure as her power increased.


Her power kept on surging until it was almost double of the previous amount and then stopped. And that wasn’t everything.


She suddenly remembered the bonus reward.


In a moment, her status page was back in front of her.


Name: Kuroka

Rank: Tier 5

Skills: Senjutsu(Lv 48), Touki(Lv 29),  Devil Magic(Lv. 35), Mind Magic(Lv. 32),....

Quests

Inventory


And sure enough, the level of Senjutsu had increased too.


She tried using her powers and realised the difference instantly. The power flowed far more easily than before. She could use the same skills at a faster speed too.


Who knows how much training it would have taken her to get to this level and she got it just like that?


There was another reward for all this, wasn’t there?


Basic Answers.


“Give me the answers? What is this all about? What are you and why did you choose me? Why is this guy so important? What did you mean by the end of the World?”


Her answers came soon after.


Alien Gods, World Invasion, End of the World?


….


….


She found herself unable to breathe at the information. Were they going to die just like that? No. Probably in the other future, but not in this one.


In this world, she has the System.


With this power, perhaps she could stop all of that from happening.


And then she remembered about Shirone.


Wait, what was all that about Shirone marrying a pervert? Tell me everything?


“In your original world, your sister would have fallen in love with a pervert who publicly leers at her breasts, for defeating you. She would then go on to marry him. And in the future, even you would marry him and have kids….only for all of them to die in the invasion. What the hell, Host? Get your game on. You can surely do better than that.”


….


“What the hell! Who is that pervert? Tell me the name of that pervert. I will kill him right now and end everything right here and now.” She scowled but no answers came.


Main Quest Issued


Objective: Within the next dozen years become the wife of Takashi Furukawa.


Reward: Happiness


Failure: Possible End of the World.


Note: Using magic or threats will not be appreciated and will have extremely dire consequences. Be warned.


Main Quest cannot be rejected.

….


Why would she need to marry this guy?


What kind of quest is this?


She asked but there were no replies.


And what’s so special about this guy?


‘Host doesn’t have sufficient clearance to know the answer. Please work harder.’


….


….


Happiness?


She needed to get stronger. At least give her something that would make her stronger to prepare for the future.


Quest Issued


While the first step might have been easy, the journey will be full of ups and downs. You cannot spend your entire life as a cat with your future husband. How and who would he even marry a cat?


Meet Takashi Furukawa in your humanoid form and go on a date with him.


Reward: Random Skill


Failure: Eat Cat Food for the rest of the week.


Note: Using magic or threats will not be appreciated and will have extremely dire consequences. Be warned.


Accept Quest: Y/N.


Hmm….a date.


Sure.


It shouldn’t be too hard for her.


Kuroka was sure she could have him eating out of her palms in a week. With this thought, she accepted the quest.


But first she needed a nap. The meal was good and she was tired from all the emotional stress due to this System.


She dismissed the barrier and went back to the room to take her nap on the pillow which was set aside for her. As she was about to sleep, her attention went to the guy this….System was pushing her towards. She wasn’t sure what kind of future awaited her this time but she was sure that she was going to change it for the better.


Huh….did the guy’s magic power seem larger than before?


She didn’t think much as she was already falling into the embrace of slumber and dreams of the bright future.


- Takashi -


I woke up in the morning and got ready for the day at school.


Mornings were always easy as I could eat cereal for breakfast and Yoruichi liked milk for her meals.


The cat was still asleep and only woke up when I was about to leave.


I have to get a collar and a litter box for her.


Till then I guess I will have to leave her alone. I didn’t know the neighbours and neither did I have any friends in this place.


Moreover, Yoruichi seemed like a smart cat and could probably stay safe till I was back.


“Take care of yourself, Yoru-chan. Here’s the food for lunch. I will try to get back early. Till then, stay safe.” I went closer and kissed her head. “By the way, I think this house might be haunted. I might have heard a girl’s moans last night….or maybe it’s the neighbours being loud. See ya.”


The cat pawed playfully at my face because of the joke and I laughed.


Having someone to live with me is not bad.


_________________________________x____________________________________


“And then we need to add the two roots to get the answer. Does anyone have any doubts till this point?” I turned around and asked the class.


Taking a look over the class, I looked at the students copying the problem.


I even spotted some girls throwing me looks as usual but by now I had grown used to these. It was just that when I looked at a familiar redhead, she lowered her head blushing.


Man….this was awkward.


Teaching the girl who asked me out on a date yesterday.


At least she hadn’t done anything like that today.


The bell rang and the time for the class was over.


It was the lunch break and I remembered that I had forgotten to buy a bento today. Getting things ready for Yoru-chan took more time than I had realised, finally leaving me in a hurry.


I guess I have to wait till school is over.


The other teachers were eating in the staff room and I didn’t want to feel awkward as the only one not eating so I decided to take a walk around the school. Maybe the library would be a good place.


With this in mind, I went to the library.


Kuoh Academy Library was huge and yet had a tranquil atmosphere.


There were not many people in the library at that time either as most of them were out to eat.


I picked up a book and within moments was lost in reading.


A few minutes later, I sensed someone sitting in front of me and looked up.


Purple eyes stared back at me.


It took me a moment to realise who the girl smiling at me was.


Akeno Himejima, the second most famous girl in this school. Actually, hold on a moment, who makes these rankings again?


Don’t they have anything better to do?


“Ara sensei, why are you sitting alone in the library? Aren’t you eating your lunch?” She asked me with a smile.


“Miss Himejima, right. I am not alone in the library….” I started speaking but realised midway that others had left the library when I wasn’t paying attention so I changed my statement in between. “You are here too.”


She giggled at my statement. “That’s true I guess. By the way, are you not eating lunch?”


“Ah, I….didn’t have the time to get lunch in a hurry today. I will eat something later.”


“That’s no good, you know. Taking care of your health is important. After all, I know many people who would be very sad if their favourite teacher gets ill. You know what? Here, I cooked extra today. Please share some with me.” She said as she opened a bento box on the table. When did she bring out the bento box without me realising?


“Thank you for your offer, Miss Himejima but I couldn’t possibly….” I tried denying but by then she had already separated some for me and if I were honest….the food looked delicious. It was probably the best looking meal I had seen since leaving home for work.


Apparently my stomach agreed too as it made a gurgling sound at the sight of the food.


This made the girl in front of me giggle and I couldn’t help but blush at the untimely rebellion of my stomach. In my defence, the food looked awesome.


“Then don’t mind if I take a bite.” I thanked her and picked up the chopsticks and took a bite of the food. “Oh.”


“How is it? Did you like it, Sensei?” She asked me.


“This is amazing.” I took another bite.


“Really? I am pleased that you like my cooking.” She smiled.


“Wait what! You cooked this?” I asked, surprised.


Seriously, was this girl a genius chef or did I just suck that bad at cooking?


“Yes. I cook my bento myself.” She nodded.


“That’s….you are seriously talented, Miss Himejima. This is probably the second best cooking I have eaten in my whole life.” I praised.


“What only second? Who is the first then? Your girlfriend?” She teased.


“I rolled my eyes. “Interested in those things already? Then again, I guess you are at that age now. But for your answer, no. My favourite cook is my mother.” I smiled.


“Oh. You are very close to your Okaa-sama, Sensei?”


“Yes. She has always supported me in my dreams. I would be an ungrateful twerp if I didn’t like them.” I replied as I took another bite of the food. “This is seriously good. You would make your future husband a lucky man, Miss Himejima.”


“Ara ara.” She laughed with a hand on her cheeks.


I finished half of her food without realising while we talked when another person entered the room.


We looked back and it was Akeno who spoke. “Rias!”


“Akeno and….sensei?” She asked surprised and then looked around the room. “What are you doing here, Akeno?” She asked.


“Oh, I saw sensei reading alone in the library and decided to talk to him. Turns out that sensei didn’t have his lunch today so I offered him some of mine.”


“Sensei didn’t have lunch?” She asked, suddenly looking at me.


“Ah….I didn’t have time to buy something today.” I answered awkwardly. The incident from yesterday came to the forefront of my mind again.


I tried not to let it bother me as the girl sat down in front of me, beside Akeno and put up a bento box on the table. “Then sensei, please have some of mine too. I was offered some cookies from some juniors and I don’t think I will be able to eat everything.” She opened the box and slid it towards me.


This box, while not even close to Akeno’s bento, was also good.


Now, I was already eating one student’s lunch so it would be awkward if I rejected hers….thinking of this, I, a bit hesitantly took a bite of her food.


As I ate the food, I saw the girl’s face brighten up.


Ignore it.


The girls talked to me for a while and it was almost the end of the lunch break so we decided to leave.


On the way back, I heard some commotion and saw a group of students chasing three boys with shinai in their hands.


What the hell?!


Are they fighting on school premises?


I quickly ran there to see what was going on and the two girls followed me.


The girls had the three boys surrounded between them and it looked like they were going to give them the beating of their lifetime.


“What is going on here?” I asked, stopping the girls from attacking as they looked towards me.


“Furukawa-Sensei!”


I looked at the brown haired girl. “Murayama, correct? What is going on here? What are you girls doing? Why are you attacking these boys?” I asked, seriously. This was the first time I had encountered this kind of behaviour in this school.


I remembered these students.


They were mostly first years.


“Sensei, these….these perverts were peeping at us in the changing room.”


“What!” I was taken aback at the accusation and looked at the three boys who were scared shit at the moment.


“Are you sure?” I asked. These kinds of allegations were quite serious. It was better to confirm it before taking action.


“Yes Sensei. It’s not the first time either. This year alone, it’s the sixth time we have caught them doing so. Who knows how many times they have escaped without being caught.”


“....hah!” I was actually stunned and at a loss of words. “Sixth time?!”


“Yes.”


“Did you girls complain to the teachers?”


“We told the Student Council and they said they would take care of the matter but these three always return back to their usual behaviour. They are infamous in the school as the Perverted Trio.”


….


I felt a vein bulge on my forehead at the words of the girls.


“I see. Don’t worry. Let me take care of them. Also, I understand the anger and frustration of you all for the breach of your privacy but please, resorting to violence is not the way society works. Don’t degrade yourself for this.” I reassured them.


“Yes Sensei.” The girls looked a bit reluctant but still moved back.


I walked in front of the boys and I realised that one of them was not looking at me even as I stood in front of him and was instead staring behind me. It took me a moment to realise that he was looking at Rias and Akeno.


“Boobs.”


….


Did this guy….just say what I think he did?


Looking at the reaction of the girls, especially as Rias crossed her arms a bit defensively while the rest looked at them as if they were lower than bugs, it seems that I was not mishearing things.


This confirms it. These guys….they are really the culprits.


I moved slightly, standing right in front of the two girls, covering them from his gaze and looked at the enraged students.


“I promise that I will take care of this matter. You all are here to learn with the peace of your mind. If you don’t feel protected here, it’s the fault of us teachers. I will definitely give you all a satisfactory answer.” I reassured them again.


“Thank you, Sensei.”


I turned towards both Rias and Akeno. “Thank you for today but I have to take care of this matter first.”


“Please take your time, sensei.” They nodded and moved aside. 


Finally looking at the three guys, I ordered in a cold tone. “Follow me.”


The first place I led them was to the Teacher’s office and asked around if any of the teacher’s knew about the whole mess they had been creating.


It turns out that the teacher’s didn’t know everything and had left everything to the Student Council because the Student Council President had reassured them that she could take care of this matter….which seemed utterly stupid.


As this was not even the first offence, I had their parents called over to the school and personally had them suspended for a month.


Even their parents seemed to have given up.


I felt kinda sorry for them but then again, if they couldn’t even teach their kids basic manners, then some fault for it lies in them as well.


Next up, I called for one of the staff to help fix the place where the fools were peeping from. Seriously, how was there a hole in the wall and if so, why does no one fix it?


Finally, when everything was done, it was time to deal with the Student Council.


I was seriously pissed at these brats.


I knocked at the door of the Student Council Room and the door was opened by the girl who had shown me to the Principal’s office on my first day. Tsubaki Shinra.


“Sensei?”


“Is Miss Shitori in there? I have something to talk to her about.”


“Oh, yes. Please come in.”


The office looked like a teacher’s room. In fact, it was actually better than the teacher’s room. What even was the work of the Student Council for them to need something like this at their disposal?


But let’s not get off topic.


The students in the room stood up and greeted me and I nodded back.


“I have had a very tiring day today so let’s get straight to the point, Miss Shitori. What did the Student Council do to deal with the case of the three first year boys who were caught peeping on the girls of the Kendo Club?”


They were taken aback by my question but answered nonetheless.


“They were punished by extra duty after school.” She answered, straightening her glasses, something which was unnecessary as it was already perfectly in place.


“I assume that was the first time you encountered this problem. While a bit light, I accept your reasoning. Then what about the next four times?”


“Excuse me?”


“What did you do the next four times they were caught doing the same. I was informed that the students had complained to the Student Council. Did you get the complaints or were they lying?” I asked, staring at her, looking for any hints of lies.


“They were punished accordingly.” She said after some time.


“‘Accordingly’ is a very flexible word, Miss Shitori. It varies from person to person. I would like to know the exact details of their punishment because if they were not bothered to correct their behaviour, it was evident that your methods didn’t work. Did you inform the teachers about this?” I asked.


“I….took permission from the teachers and they allowed me to deal with the matter.” She defended.


“How many times?”


“What?”


“I was only told that you informed them once. Only once were they told that such a thing had happened on the school premises. I think you misunderstood something. When he gave you the permission to deal with this matter, it was only for that once. Then what of the next four times. Why did you not inform the teachers of this matter?”


“I….I assure you….”


“Assurances don’t run the school, Miss Shitori. Actions do. I have heard some good things about you from the teachers so I will give you this advice. You are here to learn, so learn. If something is beyond your capabilities, ask the person in charge to deal with it. Knowing when to pull back is also a skill necessary in management. In this case, you, by not going to the required authority on time, the problem which could have been solved much earlier lasted longer. Tell me, are you perhaps friends with the boys?” I asked.


I had thought of several reasons why the incidents were never reported and this was one of the top ones.


“Furukawa-sensei, are you insinuating that I am covering for the boys?” She asked hotly.


“Well yes. Look at it from my position and tell me if that doesn’t sound probable?” I asked. “Or if you have any better reason, give me one?”


“I didn’t want to escalate the matter to not affect the reputation of the school and ruin the lives of those boys.” She replied, angry at the accusation but this reply just made the vein in my head throb even more.


I looked at her and tried to control my temper and was finding it extremely hard to do so. “Tell me something, Miss Shitori….”


“Yes.”

“Are you stupid!” I bursted out. They were taken aback at my outburst but I didn’t give them any chances of taking back and went on.


“You think covering for those fools is saving the reputation of the school?! Peeping is a crime punishable by law in this country, do you know that?” I asked and saw her mouth opening but she closed it again. “Well, do you?”


She nodded.


“Then pray tell me, what would happen if these same students got the impression that their behaviour was not that serious, and started doing this outside the school and got caught? Or would those girls chasing and beating other students in broad daylight be a good thing? Would that bring great laurels to the school’s reputation?”


Her mouth opened like a fish and was about to reply but I raised my hand and shut her up.


“And pray tell me this, if the problem continues like it has been, do you think the girls of the Kendo Club or any others who were the victims of their crimes are just going to keep quiet? That they won’t complain to their parents and the word that Kuoh Academy has a deplorable security for girls won’t spread? There are so many things wrong with your reasoning that I could stand here all day and lecture you and we still won’t be done.”


I took a deep breath calming myself down.


“I was told by some teachers that you are planning to open a school of your own and wanted to learn management by the means of this position. Well, if this is your attitude then you would perhaps make for a great businesswoman but I promise you that you would be an incredibly shitty educator.”


“Sensei!”

“What, Miss Shitori? Am I wrong?” I challenged and she actually backed down. “You were selected by the votes of the students of this school, correct?” She nodded.


“They selected you because they trusted you enough to protect them and help maintain a safe environment for them to learn. But here you are completely ignoring the very students who put their faith in you….to do whatever it is that you were doing. You did nothing to solve their problems. Hell, you all probably didn’t even investigate this matter. Those three were peeping through a hole in the changing room….all six times from the same place. The least you could have done was get someone to get it fixed. Sigh….what a disappointment.”


She looked down and I observed that she had her fists clenched and there were actually tears in the corner of her eyes.


I shook my head and left the room leaving the Student Council in silence.


The day’s events exhausted me.

To Be A Hero

Chapter 10: Closures


______________________________________________________________________


- Salvatore -


We looked at the clown, groaning in pain as the magic did its work.


Normally dragging the soul of Jahil wouldn’t have been so hard. The reason for the difficulty was the fact that Footman himself was made of tens of thousands of souls all mashed up together in ritualistic mix.


This made not only hiding inside the gaps of the soul easier for someone with Jahil’s magical expertise, especially considering that he had the help of Feldway, but also made it hard to separate the guy away.


It would have been impossible for normal people to do this but for Rimuru and I, it wasn’t that big of a problem. The combined power of Raphael and Solomon made the work a breeze.


Suddenly, a shadow-like figure burst out of Footman’s soul and rushed out at a quick speed, trying to leave the room and escape, only to be met face first by the Barriers cast using Uriel and modified to contain souls by Rimuru.


Got him!


Within moments, Solomon manipulated the barriers to shrink around him, trapping him inside the small cubic barrier.


The form of the monster slowly became visible mostly as a ghostly shadow as he didn’t possess a body anymore but still clear to show everyone his identity.


“Jahil!” I heard the Elven Ancestor growl, something which seemed quite contrary to her character. Even the other people in the room were pissed.


I, however, couldn't be bothered by them as I had to concentrate on Footman.


Jahil bursting out of him had injured his soul which Solomon was currently patching up.


“Rimuru, heal Footman.”

Her life had changed completely in the last month once more after coming under his rule. She was named, a ritual which increased her power to levels at which she was confident of facing her cousin in a straight fight. Even Masaomi became stronger, becoming a sage.


But perhaps the best part was the fact that she got married to the love of her life.


Cleria loved her current life.


Working for King Salvatore with her husband, teaching the kids and watching over the workings of the Kingdom and spending time  with her new friends….it was a perfect life.


That was not to say they didn’t have any worries.


King Salvatore’s memories of different worlds had been a smack on the face for both Masaomi and her.


Their world….couldn’t be that messed up right?


Could it be that Salvatore was too drunk on the day and forgot or misremembered the memories for once?


The future of their entire world lies in the hands of a….dumb teenager who retains nothing but breasts in his mind….


Was it perhaps a blessing that they were summoned to this world? A reward for remaining faithful to their love?


Because just thinking about it made her shiver with disgust.


Salvatore felt the same too, being a resident of their world too.


Talk about surprises, the wielder of Dragon King Vritra’s Sacred Gear had somehow revived the Dragon and even transformed her into a True Dragon….a True Dragon. That title was only given to one being in their world.


While Masaomi was happy to know that he was related to the church and his brother might be trained as an exorcist, the whole probable future of the world still weighed heavily on their minds too.


No wonder Salvatore was trying so hard to get back to their world.


Still, she had sworn an oath to serve him with Masaomi, loyally and she would follow through with her oaths. She didn’t want anyone to ruin her perfect life either.


That’s why when she spotted the invaders in the line of sight, she didn’t hold back.


“Five Intruders detected.”  the voice of Lord Solomon echoed in her head as the information about the intruders flooded her mind.


Her Clan Trait Worthless had evolved into an Intrinsic Skill when she was summoned to this world. It had the same function as her magic but was far more efficient in the use of it.


Apart from this, she got another Skill, a Unique Skill, Disrupter.


It had a similar function to her Worthless Skill, only in this case it could disrupt any physical attack completely.


When combined with her Worthless Ability, it gave her great defensive potential.


And finally the Extra Skill: Sage given to her after she was named.


This was the final piece of the puzzle. It gave her higher comprehension and thought acceleration thus allowing her to understand the Skills of her opponent far more easier than before.


It only took her a moment to understand all the information and lock onto the position of the intruders and with her next move, a barrier formed over the area.


This barrier was reinforced with both her Skills, Worthless and Disrupter, making it a perfect barrier for trapping anyone.


Since the mice were in the cage, let the hunt begin.


- Unnamed Blood Shadow -


He rushed through the forests of Falmuth, or was it Camelot now?


What did it matter for him?


The only thing that mattered was completing the mission. 


His life rested on it.


Sigh….


Just how did he get stuck in this mess?


One moment he was submitting a thesis for his Doctorate degree and the next moment he was in this damned world, stamped with a slave brand, forever bound to serve the ones who summoned him or die.


Those five bastards treated all the summoned otherworlders lower than dirt. Even disposable pawns would be treated better than them.


Evans was sure they must have killed at least hundred or so of them to have such kind indifference.


He hated the feeling of being treated like dirt….but there was nothing he could do.


They had the switch to his life under their thumbs and would dispose of him at the slightest inconvenience.


He had witnessed enough deaths of his fellow friends to know this.


That's why he worked hard. In the last four years, he fought tooth and nail to survive, just for a chance at survival, just in the hopes that one day things would change.


Perhaps he could become strong enough to break through these shackles.


His hard work paid off as he rose through the ranks at a high speed and even became an Enlightened, something very rare few became in this world.


It was however still not enough to free him from these chains.


As for becoming a Saint….Evans never hoped for it, realising the rarity of those in this world, the less said about a Hero, the better. That one had a lot to do with a matter of chance rather than skill of an individual. Existences such as them was far beyond his level. The likes of Hinata Sakaguchi and Salvatore, the king of the nation they were infiltrating were like stars in the sky. He could see them but never hoped to reach them.


Especially Salvatore. That was the person Evans both admired and envied.


A person in exactly the same position  as him and yet he rose beyond the crowd and became someone who could take over his captors and rule.


Even when infiltrating his Kingdom, he couldn’t help but think of the man and how he might be face to face with the same guy in this mission.


He doubted his chances of survival. Unfortunately for him, at least this way he still had some chances.


The other side was certain death.


All his thoughts were suddenly broken when he sensed the shift in mana of the area.


Looking around, he saw a semi-transparent barrier all around the place.


Shit.


“Separate and run!” He commanded in a loud voice.


His squad members in his command suddenly became aware of the situation and tried to run in different directions but were unsuccessful.


“I am afraid that’s not an option anymore.” He heard a voice in front of him as a figure entered the barrier from outside.


The man had black hair and black eyes and was holding a sword in his hand.


“I suggest that you don’t put up any resistance. If you do that, we could free you from your bindings and take you under the protection of Camelot. Trust us, we do not have any intention of fighting if you don’t.” Another voice came from behind them. On looking in that direction, he saw a man white haired man in glasses walking slowly towards them from there.


His heart stopped for a moment at those words but he quickly shook off the feeling.


There is no way that’s true. They were probably baiting him to drop guard.


He unsheathed his blade and dashed forward, intending to create a diversion with his attack. While doing this, he activated his Skill, Gemini, creating a clone of himself and joining him to flank the black haired guy.


Meanwhile, his teammates took on the while haired one.


The man defended himself with his sword, pushing him back.


What strength! However that would not be enough.


His clone was already in position to take down the neck of the guy but the next instant, something unbelievable happened.


The clone, whose sword was just on the verge of touching the black haired guy….just vanished suddenly in thin air.


“What?!” The sudden change broke his concentration and one of his steps fell in the wrong place, destabilising his balance and the black haired guy didn’t miss this opportunity and was on his face in the next instant, the next attack flinging his sword from his hand, leaving him without any weapon.


Was this the end?


Evans closed his eyes, accepting his death but the finishing blow never came.


Instead, he felt his magic being suppressed and his body being bound, leaving him unable to move.


Ah….they were probably going to be tortured for information.


Too bad for them, they were just not capable of giving out any information.


While he couldn’t move, he could hear the voices of his squadmates and see flames of a blue colour which felt….demonic.


In a matter of minutes, the whole fight was over.


His entire squad of four A Rankers and one Special A Rank was taken down in minutes without any way of resisting.


“Can you remove the binding spells on them, Cleria?” The words shook him awake from the darkness.


The next moment, he felt a hand on his forehead and a foreign power invaded his body and after four years of hell….he felt the binding on his soul….dissolve.


He opened his eyes to look at the figure in front of his eyes and saw a white haired woman sitting beside him.


She looked at him and smiled. “Don’t worry. You are free now.”


He felt a lump in his throat those words and even the years of training didn’t prevent his eyes from getting wet.


“You will be checked and if found clean, will be given a room and offered the protection of Camelot. I am sure you understand the procedures. We cannot afford spies among us.”


A tense look appeared on his face at the words. Was he just switching hands from one cruel master to another one?


“Don’t worry. You will just be asked a few questions. Nothing complicated. I suggest that you do not lie as our King can easily catch lies. Trust me, if you were forced to do this, you will not be punished. After all, we were in the same situation as you until a while ago. King Salvatore is not the kind of person who would force you into such a situation. He has even worked and banned summoning of otherworlders since becoming a King and has been working towards it since then.” The woman reassured him and he nodded.


“Alright, we are on the clock. Could you guys give us the details of your plans? That would help out a lot.”


He nodded and slowly spoke the details of the plans….or at least the part which he knew about.


Each group only knew their own route of invasion and were never told about the other groups and only the place where they would parley to act on the plan.


They were then left to the custody of a group of soldiers while the three left for their own work.


While being led to Camelot, there was only one thought in Evans’ mind. Was this his chance at a new life?
